Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: crystaleyes77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here visiting a friend who was in the hospital. Rooms were clean and location was great. Staff on the other hand could be a lot friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU NEED TO RECUPERATE”
Reviews.Author: StaceyB757
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life! The noise level is unbelievable - they are doing construction right now and using a power nailer and a power carpet layer all day long. Sounds like jackhammers all day long and sometimes the ceiling shakes. The 'breakfast' buffet is NOT included and costs $17. The food is mediocre and what you would find at a free motel breakfast anywhere else (bagels and such). There are three hot trays (bacon, sausage and eggs). The management staff is unapologetic about this and acts as if the customer should just quietly put up with it. The buffet staff and cleaning staff are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: FromBelleProvince
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy to stay at this hotel. It's worth your money : rooms are big, well furnished and clean. The staff is very efficient but don't ask them for more ( they don't want to waste their time smiling or talking to guests). The neighbourhood is quiet and you can walk to TD Garden (if you're a hockey fan). Some renovations are going on now, so it could be a little noisy between 9 am and 5 pm (but we didn't hear anything). For a quick and cheap breakfast, you can find a place on the same sidewalk. It was our second time in this hôtel and we'll surely stay there the next time we'll go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “average or even less”
Reviews.Author: Rockinger
Reviews.Content: service at reception was ok and friendly, as i expected it form a holiday inn front desk. unfortunately i did use priority club points for a reward night in the beacon hill holiday inn, if i knew before, i probably would have used them for another hotel at another time. the rooms are clean and maybe little outdated. breakfast room looked little messy and the quality of the food, especially the warm stuff was bad (should i have said supposed-to-be-warm food?) 15-20minutes walk to downtown for the equivalent of my points i would take next time a more central hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights before heading to NY. The hotel was typical Holiday Inn in mnay respects and offered the quality and space you expect from this brand. Nice big room, all the equipment you need for your stay, flat screen tv and free internet. This hotel was a little out of town though only a 10-15 min walk so still reasonable enough to walk. The downside of this hotel was that the reception was either being repaired or just damaged and looked in a little dis-repair. The ambiance of the hotel was quite similar and, to me, needs a revamp in some areas. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful however which made us feel more welcome. The breakfast was not included in our price and seemed expensive compared with the much cheaper option of visiting the small cafe right on the bottom corner of the hotel. Overall a mid-range hotel, reasonably priced and comfortable to stay in; a small extra work could make this a very good option in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Value Option in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rttusky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an overnight to attend a Bruins game. Clean and very helpful staff, hotel is dated but well appointed and clean. We had a room with no view, cheapest we could get and were very pleased with the room. No fridge in the room ice bucket with ice down the hall. Geat pillows! We ate breakfast the next day at the restaurant in the hotel and the food was average to good, but very pricey. Location is the best part of the hotel two blocks from the MBTA red line and walking distance to the Garden (20 minutes). Hotel is 1 block from Mass General Hospital. Access to the entire subway system from the red line.

Reviews.Title: “Boston at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: SFox1955
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convient to shops, stores and anything one would need to visit this great city. The tour bus stops in front of the hotel. Great food, large and spacious rooms. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed......”
Reviews.Author: coronaman1978
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by telling you the good things.... The location, the price I got it for and the friendly front desk staff.....Now to the bad, the room was very old, in fact the bureau I believe was original and sunk in the middle to the point it almost touched the floor. The heater is very loud when it kicks on and the walls are paper thin as you could hear all the people coming home from the bars at 2:15 am. The light by my bed did not work and the bathroom is not much bigger than a port a pottie, the door almost hits the toilet when it opens. Overall it was not a bad expereience but by no means was it a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MicDelp
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night here, but was pleasantly surprised. I was impressed by the courteous and efficient front desk staff, who referred me to the self-parking garage around the corner (when I had called a few days before, I was told that they only had valet service--not true), and gave me precise and clear directions to the Boston Opera House by subway. The room was slightly worn around the edges, but very clean. The bed was very comfortable; the pillows a little too "poofy" for me but there were a lot of them which was nice. It was also nice to have real mugs and glasses provided instead of plastic or styrofoam. The only complaint I have is that the heat was very noisy when it came on, and it came on quite regularly with a loud whoosh, which doesn't help when you're not used to sleeping away from home. Lots of food choices nearby: Starbucks, Au Bon Pain, pizza, bars, etc. We didn't walk too far since it was pouring rain, but it looked on a map as though it was a good place from which to get most anywhere in Boston, either by T or on foot. I had joined their Priority Club Rewards program and was told when I checked in that because of that I had a late checkout (2pm instead of noon), and received a courtesy call in my room from the management. So they get an A+ for customer service from me. I liked this place, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “North End Convenience”
Reviews.Author: cococantada
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was recovering from a stroke at Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital and we were going to stay at this hotel for at least three weeks, so we got a special rate for families connected with Spaulding. We chose this hotel because it was within walking distnce through a lovely park and area; it was adjacent to Whole Foods, where they offer breakfast, lunch, and evening meals and a place to sit and eat. This saved us loads of money, since we were already here since Dec. 2nd and now it was several weeks later. The bathroom was a real letdown with it's tiny space and ceiling that looked like it had water damage, but who's to complain when the rate was reasonable for us? The wonderful thing was that we could walk to restaurants in the evenings when we just needed a break from the hospital and medical overload of information. The North End is trendy and close to Mass General and the T near the Liberty Hotel, a former Suffolk County Jail. We also could walk to a store where my husband would find boots for the wet conditions we experienced in December. There was also a green line a few blocks away that could take us to the Cambridge Galleria Mall, but we walked everywhere, even across the Charles River. I loved this area! I wished I lived here, in fact. The one surprise we got was having dinner down in the hotel's restaurant one evening. I ate the roasted duck and my husband had fish. There were few people in the restaurant, too. We enjoyed meal as much as the atmosphere. There is also an adjacent area with a bar for early evening cheer. This restaurant was one of the few open on Christmas Eve, which we thought we would have to use if our daughter was still at the hospital. In the end, we had a very nice stay here. There was a laundry room with two of everything, next to a computer room with a few PC's and a printer, which we easily used. An exercise room also afforded people something to do while waiting for laundry. Most floors had a vending machine offering pop, but down on the second level, where the laundry, and other facilities were, there was a snack machine, too. The back door on that level was very convenient access to the Whole Foods, CVS and other stores such as AU BON PAIN and a frozen yogurt shop. This parking and shopping area tended to be warmer and less windy than the front of the hotel and streets. It was convenient to have an eyeglass store close by when we needed a screw for our glasses and new cleaning cloths. Several streets to the east, there are more fast food places and restaurants, but we ate at two places right on Cambridge Street. Lovely area! It picked up our spirits to stay here. PS, stay on Diana's floor. She was a delightful, caring maid on the eighth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms in accessible location”
Reviews.Author: major1018
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very convenient. It was 1 block from the closest T stop, which was really nice, and because of that T stop it made it easy to get anywhere in the city. The rooms were very comfortable and were a decent size for a double room. The bathroom was a little small, but we only stayed for one night so that wasn't a problem. When we got there they told us that they were in the process of doing renovations, but I did not hear any construction, and the rooms didn't seem as dated as they could have been. Overall, this hotel was a great value and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: rwoman11
Reviews.Content: Location: The property is not far from the Bowdoin T Station, which is closed on the weekends. We walked from Government Center, which was a fairly easy walk. There are many places nearby - a Whole Foods is next door, Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are across the street. TD Garden, Boston Common, the North End, and many other places are within easy reach on foot. I've read complaints about noise from the hospital across the street, but we had no issue. Check In: Check in was pretty painless. The receptionist thanked me for my Plat PC status and provided us with room keys. Platinum Benefits: I have yet to be upgraded as a Plat at any US property (most of my stays are in Europe). They did give us vouchers for the continental breakfast - we could have added the hot bar for about $4-5, but chose not to as the cold bar was sufficient. Room: The room was spacious, but definitely dated. Beds and linens were comfortable and the bathroom amenities were good. Facilities: This property has many conference rooms, a gym (did not use this trip), and a restaurant. We only visited the restaurant for breakfast. The hotel had wifi, which worked fine for both my sister and I. Overall, my experience here was fine. The location is good and would motivate me to use this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for us as we were in town for a Frozen Fenway games and visiting friends. The hotel is right by the Charles T station so get around town was easy. Now the hotel itself was alright. We could here the renovations going on in the floors above us, the bed was nice but had these very small "European sized" pillows and no normal sized pillows were available. The furniture was very worn and I am glad they will be updating and renovating the hotel. They need to expand the very very small bathrooms and get rid of the crappy shower doors while they are at it. The restaurant down stairs was pretty decent. My boyfriend and his parents enjoyed their food but I only had coffee so I cannot attest to the quality. Some of the front desk employees were very helpful but the one that checked us in was not. Overall the stay was good but I'd rather come back when all the rooms are redone!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service not their strong point”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location / price can't really be beat. Their rooms are dated, but I understand they're renovating... Checking in was not easy. We used Priceline, for two rooms. Our traveling partner was delayed and wouldn't be able to check into her room until the next day. I told them I understood we were still paying for the night and went out of my way to ask that the reservation would still be available in the morning for her to check in. They assured me she would be able to check in in the morning. Well, they cancelled her reservation. It got fixed, but example 1 of things not being easy. I also feel that your front desk staff should be knowledgeable about the area. I asked the front desk if they could suggest the nearest family-friendly restaurant. We had just gotten off a plane after traveling since 4 a.m. and our room was not ready. After several moments of silence and a very confused look on her face, someone standing nearby mentioned how close we were to Quincy Market area. These are the types of things that should be second nature. Upon checking out, I stopped to see the front desk because there was a parking charge from someone who had visited us on our bill. She had paid in cash for the parking and had a receipt. They assured me it had already been removed from our bill. I just checked; we were charged $40. Called to correct and was just sent to someone's voicemail. Great. It's these interactions that make me hesitant to say "yes, definitely you're best bet in the area."

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: L F
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjoining rooms for our family from December 29th to December 31st 2011. We went to Boston to see the Celtic game. On our last trip we stayed a few blocks away at a pricier "upscale" hotel. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill was a much better choice. The rooms are big, the beds are comfortable and the restaurant has a nice buffet breakfast. In addition to the close walking distance to TD Garden and several other attractions, the thing that makes this hotel great is the staff. I can't say enough about how nice they are. From the moment we pulled up, the valet guys, the doorman and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The young girl at the reception desk, really knows the area and I'm glad I took her advice about several restaurants in the area. She told us where to go, where not go and the best way to get there. The hostess at the restaurant also deserves a compliment, she was very nice to my young daughter, going above and beyond her hosting duties.The only complaint that I had was when I went to the restaurant for a late night snack for the kids. The bartender showed me the dessert menu and the pictures of the pieces of cake looked huge. When I opened the container, I couldn't believe that the pieces that they gave me were small thin slivers. Barely enough for one person. I spent $22 on two tiny pieces of cake and 2 teas (that I could have made in my room for free except I needed decaf). I told the lady at the front desk, who agreed with my complaint, but told me she could do nothing about it. I still think they should have reimbursed me. It wasn't right. Besides that, I highly recommend this hotel and compliment the staff for their hospitality. I hope the manager reads this and rewards his staff for such great service. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boston”
Reviews.Author: AmmieFay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston form Thursday 29th Dec 2011 to Saturday 31st Dec 2011. It really was a wonderful trip. The holiday Inn Beacon Hill is prefectly located for visitors to this fabulous city. We were within walking distance of many local attractions (Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, Boston Common, Beacon Street) and also a stop on the trolley tour around the city was just outside our hotel. There is aslo a very good pharmacy and whole foods store located directly beside the hotel so if you wanted something nice up to the hotel room and weren't keen on anything on the roomservice it was just a short pop over to the store. The trolley tour around the city is definately worth it. For $34 we had great value and learned so much about the culture of Boston. The drivers were so knowledgable and really great fun as we went around the city. Would really recommend Boston as a short stay city break.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: I had three hotels to pick from on this trip. This one had good reviews. It is in a very nice area, easy walk to many great restaurants. It is right next to Mass General Hospital. There is some noise from helicopters coming and going. This also causes some traffic congestion in the morning. Staff was good. Parking was valet only and was $40 per night. The bathrooms had been remodeled but the carpet was old. There appeared to be a mascara stain on one of the pillows. Easy drive across the bridge ro Cambridge. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: remcdani
Reviews.Content: I understand that the property is undergoing renovation but there are a few things that are simply inexcusable. The biggest problem was the cleanliness of my room. I understand that hair happens..but when I find hair in the shower, the sink, in the bed, and on my pillows it is a little concerning. There was also couple of dead bugs inside my sheets. The staff is anything but friendly. When I walked in the room I grabbed the luggage rack and it was completely broken..something that should have been already fixed. When I alerted a front desk agent she replied, "I can't do anything about that". Even if they had no extras on hand they could have easily found a replacement from another room. Overall, GREAT location, average stay at best. Also, construction noise starting around 6:30am and ending around 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, no extras not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived at the HolidayInn, the bell boy was very rude demanding us to take the car for valet and that we were not allowed to stop for a little while to unload our bags!!! Then the receptionist was giving us attitude claiming she did not have our booking, meanwhile she knew that there were other means of booking - via prepaid bookings etc!! They left all the tea/water amenities above the toilet..see photo below!! NOT WORTH THE MONEY - no microwave, INTERNET IS VERY SLOW(although free). There are better hotels in Boston for the same amount of money. The location is in the city so therefore it is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: megansworldtravel
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and we appreciated the smooth check in after flying in from London. The room was clean with comfortable beds. Good location but trying to get one of the cab drivers who were hanging around outside to take us to the airport the next day was quite an ordeal. A la Carte breakfast was good but buffet overpriced for what was on there.

Reviews.Title: “We recently stayed the night here.”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the night here last weekend. Because his company was having their holiday party in the NorthEnd in Boston. The price was right!! The room was quite large, and the bed was comfy to sleep on. Overall we enjoyed our stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TommyKConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We visit Boston often to visit our kids attending college and try and locate reasonable hotels to spend the night. We stayed this past Saturday night. We found this on Hotwire at $81. The hotel is located in a very convenient location. The staff was very personable. The rooms and especially bathrooms are dated, but for the price it can't be beat. It seems generally very clean, however, there was a room service tray with dirty dishes on the floor in the hallway sitting the entire time we were there. Didn't understand that, but... Wifi is free as well. Valet parking is steep at $40 but parking downtown is expensive regardless where you park aside from probably the Boston Common garage which is more reasonable especially on the weekends. All in all a great deal and a good nights sleep. The rating is the result of the combination of price and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Adams
Reviews.Content: Compared with other Boston hotels you get good value here. The location is good if you want to walk or the T is 2 blocks away. Not really located in the historic tony part of Beacon Hill but within 10 minutes you are there. Lots of great restaurants and sights nearby. I would recommend the hotel if you will be sleeping in the room only. I found the rooms to be clean and adequate in every way , and I am very picky. I took people's advice and got a room facing the whole foods parking lot , and the room was not noisy . I would stay here again because of price and location. I did hear an occasional siren but it was not bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Personable Front Staff”
Reviews.Author: valchrisg
Reviews.Content: My children and I had a wonderful time staying at the Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill. Kip from the Front Desk and Anthony the Bell Man were very helpful and personable. We will definitely stay when we visit again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, central location”
Reviews.Author: NMorris
Reviews.Content: I hate writing reviews but I see where other tripadvisor reviews have helped me greatly so here goes: The hotel was my home for 11 days - I was in Boston for a workshop and presentation. I am a Priority Club member via AA for Holiday Inn, and my room was upgraded to a suite. This was quite nice, the hotel seems worn, and could use a little work, not full on face-lift but you get my drift. The breakfast buffet offered many choices and whole foods is literally next door to the hotel and I had to fight hard to not overeat. The staff was fantastic,and friendly they were very helpful. The location is great close to Mass General and the T- (red line) which makes it very convenient for getting around Boston and Cambridge. This is a good hotel, in a very nice area, that has great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: dsheridanq
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days and 3 nights here to attend a training seminar. Room was clean, Bed was comfortable and pillows were great. Free wifi, but very SLOW. Main concern is that it's next to Mass. General Hospital and close to a Fire Department so sirens blare throughout the night. Did not appreciate the wakeup call from the city garbage collectors at 6:30 a.m. on Thursday morning. They must get paid by the decibel level. Food is hotel food. Great food elsewhere. Hotel is downtown so its pretty close to everything. One thing to keep in mind if you drive in is that hotel only does valet parking and it's $40 per night to park car here, not to mention tip to valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carcol
Reviews.Content: Good location Great value (price / Value) (isolation is not really good - quite noisy)

Reviews.Title: “decent price”
Reviews.Author: krissy1103
Reviews.Content: The particular weekend we stayed, most hotels were either booked or far away from the city. The people at the hotel were very nice, we received good service. The location was 2 blocks from 2 T stations and was pretty close to a lot of the sights. Our room had a fridge, big screen TV (which blocked the mirror behind it). The gym was very nice as the machines looked like they were recently upgraded (2 bikes, 3 threadmills, 1 elliptical). The pool was closed for the winter time I guess. However, our room looked like it could use some TLC. Two fo the electric plugs were falling apart, nicks and dents on furniture/mirrors/ etc. This is by no means a 5 star hotel but it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Near the T”
Reviews.Author: smack5
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night at Holiday Inn Boston at Beacon Hill. Front desk was friendly, efficient. Our room was clean, just fine. Great location - near the T (red line) so very convenient for getting around Boston and to Cambridge. We were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Boston”
Reviews.Author: SallyJet
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights in October. The hotel itself looks a bit tired as far as interiors go but the staff and the location made up for it. Across the road is a fantastic store call wholefoods which sell everything you could wish for. It has a great takeaway section which includes tea, coffee, etc. it took us 5 mins to walk to Beacon Hill which in my opinion is the most beautiful part of Boston, little shops, cobbled streets and spectacular town houses. The rooms were large and the bed was comfortable. The only downside was the windows dont open so for anyone like me who likes fresh air it was a bit frustrating .

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff great”
Reviews.Author: lydiatwads
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for an anniversary trip in October. Kip at the front desk was great and upgraded our room to a very nice suite with a view of the river as my husband is a Priority Club member for Holiday Inn. We liked that we were able to purchase tour bus tickets in the lobby and the bus stopped in front of the hotel to make getting around Boston easy. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel prior to check in and after check out to maximize our time in Boston. The breakfast buffet had many choices and the staff was attentive. My only comment is that the room could have been a little cleaner - there was trash behind the dresser and the bathroom floor wasn't thoroughly cleaned. However, the room decor, amenities, and location worked out great for us.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: Louise F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a week long trip to the Boston area. I booked a junior suite and on arrival I was disappointed that the suite was actually a large guest room (I guess that is what "junior" means). The hotel was a good location but the furniture was shabby and the bathrooms small and outdated (every bit their 3 rating). On our fifth day I noted a six legged insect and brought it to the desk. It was a bed bug. The staff on duty quickly agreed to a room change and to put all of our clothing through the dryer to kill any bugs, eggs etc. so we did not in turn infect our own homes on our return home - some souvenir. On our return late that evening we had been moved to a standard room with two double beds and no microwave. When I inquired about the down grade I was advised that this was "complimentary" because I had paid through Expedia and there was nothing they could do. I declined an offer of breakfast the next morning. I recognize that bed bugs can occur in any hotel but I feel that this was not dealt with properly. I was not asking for anything that what I had paid for -a suite. I left this hotel saying "never again" to any Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “nice room”
Reviews.Author: abingsyu
Reviews.Content: Nice room, hotel good, spacious. Rooms with wifi with LCD TV, safety box Bed very comfortable and large with elevator

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good hotel, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Beacon Hill 11-17 October. We took a taxi from the airport (around $30-35), and were checked in by a most efficient and helpful receptionist, who pointed out 2 good restaurants to eat in, when we asked her for recommendations. We were upgraded to the 14th floor, overlooking wholefoods/CVS/City centre that other reviewers mentioned. The room was average sized, plenty of room for two large cases, just enough coathangers for our stay, and perfect air conditioning. The 6ft wide bed was very comfortable, the furniture was showing some wear and tear, the only thing I would ask to improve was the bathroom door which had seen better days at the bottom. Yes the bathroom is small, but a great shower, and room to use hairdryer, so I was happy. I enjoyed the free wi-fi for 4 days (it then wouldn't work for me, but I did all I needed to do by then and there is a number to ring if you have problems connecting). The hotel is in a great location 5 minutes away from the T. great boutique shops on Charles Street around the corner, lovely walk into the city centre and it felt a very safe place to stay. We had breakfast every day in the hotel restaurant, we thought the staff were so friendly and helpful, and the buffet food although standard each day was plentiful and replenished (yes even on a weekend!). Everyone we met from receptionist to cleaning staff to valets, were so, so helpful, if we went back to Boston, we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandru81
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for some sight-seeing, and this hotel was right in the middle of everything. So, that was perfect! The rooms are okay, but I found the bathroom a bit outdated. Parking is $40 a night, which is steep, but we didn't need to worry about the car. It was nice that it was taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovepeas09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a few days in Boston for our anniversary. We wanted to be near the sites and sounds of Boston and pay a reasonable rate. The Holiday Inn Boston at Beacon Hill is a beautiful property and we would stay there again. The front desk staff was very helpful and the room was very clean. They are very close to many of the cities main attractions and the T is just a short walk away. This is everything we wanted and more!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches in the room”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: I was lying in bed one night and saw a cockroach walking acrossnthe floor. It was as long as one of my fingers. I called the front desk and they sent someone up immediately. I asked the person if he has seen any cockroaches at the hotel before and he told me "no". After giving the bug a second look, he told me that it was not a cockroach but just a water bug. I think he thought that I was stupid. Not 15 minutes later, I found another cockroach in the bathroom. It was about the same size as the first one. The manager, Lee came to the room this time, but could not find it. He was apologetic but there was not much he could do. He told me to stop bynthe front desk the next morning to have housekeeping thoroughly clean the room while I was gone for the day. The lady at the front desk was made aware of my situation from the previous night and apparently thought it was funny. When I returned that night, I was told that the room was cleaned but no roaches were found. Fortunately, I only had one more night at the hotel. This will be the last time I stay in this hotel and am considering not staying in the Holiday Inn chains ever. I spend over 100 nights/year in hotels. I find that Marriotts and Hyatts are better, in general. Even better than the Crowne Plazas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller0752_10
Reviews.Content: Great clean kingsize room with all amenities. Very good location. Valet parking ($40) with in and out privleges. Anthony the fantastic bellman.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - THEIVES!”
Reviews.Author: iestokes
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer - I have been an active member of the Tripadvisor community for several years and rely on the accuracy of reviews posted on this site. Please check my credentials, I am not on here to rant. The Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill is engaged in some questionable and borderline illegal business practices and I suggest that you strongly reconsider if you are thinking of booking here. I stayed at this hotel for one night in September of 2011. I found the rooms to be acceptable and the location is excellent. Our stay went over without a problem however, after we checked out of the hotel, our account was charged $400 for a smoking fee when we were NOT smoking in the room. We immediately took action, calling the hotel manager to correct the erroneous charge. I am a business professional and was traveling to Boston with another family and no one was smoking in the room. This was made clear to the hotel manager and he was specifically asked what prompted him to charge $400 for the smoking fee. His response was that, although he could not confirm any specific damages had been done to the room, his staff noted to charge the smoking fee and 'if they say it's a blue car, it's a blue car" (his exact words). First of all, I have no clue what that means and secondly, if no damage is done to the room and it turns into a 'he said, she said' situation, the ethical thing to do would be to admit one's mistake, apologize and credit the charges back to the guest's account. This was not done, which essentially means that Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill STOLE $400 which will be used to pad it's pockets, not to clean up any damages. My only hope is that some one reads this review and decides to book their lodging elsewhere. Given the abundance of nice hotels in the area, there is absolutely no reason to stay in a location which makes it's business preying on innocent patrons. If you stay here, you run the risk of significant charges to your account on the word of some questionable hotel employee and you will have no recourse except to dispute the charge with your financial institution.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: mjm59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a sightseeing trip to Boston. We were able to walk the few blocks to the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and lots of restaurants. Massachussetts General Hospital is right across the street if that is your destination. The Beantown trolley picks you up right at the hotel entrance and there is an agent who will sell you tickets right there also. The hotel was adequate for the price and there is a small bar and restaurant on the premises. We ate at the restaurant once for breakfast only. The valet service was $40 per day which is pricey but at least we didn't have to worry about what to do with the car. The head doorman Alex was a treasure, so nice and friendly. Staff was professional and helpful when we needed them. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: cld1022
Reviews.Content: My wife was having surgury at the Mass. Eye & Ear Infirmary and this was within 2 blocks, which made it very convenient. The bed was very comfortable and my wife loved the comforter on the bed. The towels were nice and thick. The shower head was easy to adjust the spray and position you wanted. Another plus thing was you could go out into the back parking lot and access CVS (so I could pick up her prescriptions), and a Whole Foods.(Great place!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for BU parents”
Reviews.Author: skier003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for freshman move in to the dorms at BU. It was quiet, reasonably priced and very convenient to everything. We could walk to BU or take the T which was right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed one night and it was fine”
Reviews.Author: tsh72co
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and the end of a week long trip visiting the coast in NH. The room was fine and what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. Nothing fancy, but the accomodations fit the price. We ate dinner at a bar across the street so I can't offer any reviews on the restaurant. $40 for valet parking was a little steep, but there seemed to be very few choices nearby so we used it anyway. Overall, our stay was sufficient and we would likely stay here again and use some more of the hotel amenities next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Conciergefn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before. Great location and outdoor pool. Upgraded to junior suite. Was able to find street parking a block away and save on $40 parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Room was only ok”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel51013
Reviews.Content: Spent travel time here during the last week in August. The location was great but the room was outdated, fortunately though it was clean. Still at $289 per night plus $40 to park your car it was a little steep, however, I don't think you will find anything less expensive in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel well worth the $ from hotwire”
Reviews.Author: CT08specB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this past weekend and we had a good time. The hotel / room did its job overall no real complaints. The hotel was in a great location and the staff was very nice. Very close to the T (red line) and not far from anything really. The hotel was great they let us check-in at 9am Saturday and checked out 12pm Sunday all that time only $40 for parking which I dont think was bad. Def a 3 star resort but worth the stay as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, mediocre value”
Reviews.Author: jmarie426
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for $110. The location is good, a few blocks down from the MGH stop on the redline, and a few blocks the other way will take you to the blue line. Just beyond that is City Hall. All of that is nice. I had reserved a room with a kingsized bed online...after checking in, we had a room with two double beds. I called the front desk and they said they didnt have any available. (I didn't check in late at all, for the record.) That was slightly annoying...not exactly fit for a romantic getaway. The decor is really outdated, but whatever. The dresser in our room had a drawer that was clearly broken and falling off its track. The furniture in general had seen some better days. The view from our room was straight into a parking lot. So, all in all, not terrible, but not ideal either.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mjeansKS
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 5 days at this hotel while visiting Boston for a vacation. Positives: ~Decent location - about 3 blocks from the red line sub station. We were able to get all around the city fairly quickly. We bought a 7 day sub pass for only $15 each. Got our money out of it for sure! ~Room- The room we had was very large for what we expected. ~Food - We had some free breakfast coupons because we are Priority Club members. However, there was a Au Bon Pain right around the corner and a Whole Foods market right behind the hotel. I would not have paid for breakfast at the hotel. Way too expensive. ~Pleasant staff ~Refrigerator in room - we brought back some great treats from the North End and were able to keep them in our fridge. Negatives: ~The hotel was a little worn and dated. ~Pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable. ~While location is near the subway, there is not a lot to see and do right near the hotel. ~Tried to watch a movie one night, but the remote would not work. Reported it to the front desk but they were unable to get it to work. ~A bit pricey but that is Boston. We could have gotten a less expensive hotel but would have had to travel a lot further to get into the city.

Reviews.Title: “hell hole run by lunatics”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea H
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say the bellmen were awesome loved them, they provided great service. The room service was also great. The front dest staff however is rude and rediculous. First we had a question regarding the 400 dollar credit card authorization to the credit card we spent 30 minutes telling them would only be for the first night room and tax and nothing else so we supplied them another for all other charges. Gary the man at the front dest was nothing but rude. They also lost our car keys that a friend had left at the front desk for us. Lastly I awoke on the last morning to find my friend had a horrible fever. When i asked the front desk if the had any tylenol this is the conversation that happed "Hi my friend has a really bad fever do you have any tylenol?" Fronk desk- "Yes" "Great could i get two?" -"no we can't give them out" "well can i buy them?" -"no." "......what?" -we can't give them out." WHAT? WHY EVEN TELL ME YOU HAVE THEM IN THE FIRST PLACE IF I CAN'T EVEN BUY THEM FOR A MEDICAL EMERGANCY????????? in conclusion that place sucks and knows didily squat about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: michel_josee
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill for easter holiday. The location is perfectly central to all attractions downtown Boston, 10 min walk to the seashore. Located in fashionable Beacon Hill, convenient for walking through a typical New England high class neiborhood toward the historic district. Very safe location. Hotel was great - got an upgrade to higher floors, very clean hotel, very confortable bed, great breakfast. A very nice afortable place to stay downtown Boston. Will return there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: JOZCAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and we had a three year old with us. The location is just excellent. Close to Whole Foods, close to Boston Common, walking distance to nice places, close to subway, cafe's, etc. Rooms are very spacious. We used the breakfast option in the hotel which was very convenient. It is not cheap, but I think the level of service you get for the money you pay in that location is very good. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “worn out but Great staff”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, the rooms were worn out, bath door did not lock, room door jammed, rusty furniture!! but the staff were great! friendly and willing very much to help, best that I have met in many hotels! no room service no fridge in room!

Reviews.Title: “A good location to access many of Boston's top attractions”
Reviews.Author: detroiterchick
Reviews.Content: Boston's Beacon Hill neighborhood is posh and well positioned within the city to visit a varierty of popular attractions, and the Holiday Inn was a good place to stay. It was clean, roomy and the staff was friendly. This was the hotel I was given when I bid $185 per night in Boston on Priceline and was pleased with the result. However, I heard potential guests at the front desk being quoted $300 per night. I wouldn't have wanted to pay $300 per night to stay here. Unfortunately, the location demands a premium price. Parking was located nearby for $40 per night. This hotel is a 10 minute cab ride to Fenway, the Museum of Science and only a 5 - 10 minute cab ride to Fanieul Hall and Quincy Market. Note, there was no continental breakfast available at this location, but there are a variety of cute eateries available nearby that make it easy to find breakfast or lunch. There was also a shopping area near the hotel that included a Whole Foods.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Beth J
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location right on the green t line. Affordable. Clean, attractive rooms. Most of the staff very helpful and friendly. While in Boston has a heated indoor pool and hot tub. Cons: Food is expensive, slow, and just average. Pool area has carpeting that stays wet all the time and seems like it could be moldy. Pool area is dark. Pricing: Rates very wildly we heard from $125/night to $230/night. Best rate went to a long term contractor. Next best is for affiliation with one of the nearby medical centers, then affiliation with a university.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tjn752
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here based on the other reviews but glad we did. The price per night was average, the rooms were clean, the beds comfy. We had a great view. The hotel is a great location--central to many locations. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We would definately go back. Request the 9th floor with a good view! Nice having the outdoor pool too when the kids are tired from touring. Life guard always on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but Sam Viville - front desk person - was AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: lenusvyat
Reviews.Content: I have to admit - in all the travels, I have yet to meet a front desk person as nice as this! Sam Viville beats the record for the best front desk agent I have yet to encounter. The hotel also seemed ok. Room was clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I am writing such a positive review because I had such low expectations but I thought this Holiday Inn was great. We reserved two rooms for a friend's bachelorette weekend. We had no problems checking in early and our rooms were very clean. The pool was also decent size with plenty of chairs and towels. Location is fabulous - walking distance to both the red & green subway lines and walking distance to many Boston-area attractions. Reasons for 4-star instead of 5: 1. website states they have refrigerators in the rooms, but neither of our rooms did. We called to have one sent up and it never actually got cold. 2. Parking is $40 which is ridiculous. There are several parking garages for much cheaper within walking distance and metered parking on the surrounding streets. You can find a better parking deal if you drive to this hotel. 3. We requested adjoining rooms but were put on the same floor several rooms apart.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here.”
Reviews.Author: DannyD14
Reviews.Content: An all round pleasant stay, and good value for money. I would return here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: hdwiii
Reviews.Content: Went here in August 2010 and just now getting around to writing about it. Got a great deal and decided to stay here before we headed to Provincetown. The hotel is in a great central location and easy accessible to the city. Great place to come back to and unwind. Going back in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and rooms need major updating!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaRDH
Reviews.Content: While this Holiday Inn had a very friendly staff, I was disappointed with the quality of the rooms. The rooms are dingy and the decor is stuck in the 70's.Rooms aside, the hotel is in a good location...about a 15 minute walk to Quincy market and 20 minutes to the Harbor. This hotel is not worth the nightly rate of almost $300!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Jenifr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days by myself until friends could meet up with me. We all stayed here. The furniture needs updating but I had a corner room that was very spacious and I could see the lights of Fenway from my room. Comfortable. Great staff. Was there Labor Day weekend and even with the kids moving in (2 floors were "dorm floors"), not a problem and everyone was in high spirits. The restaurant was expensive and the food only so-so. The wait staff was great and solicitous. The front desk staff were friendly, professional and welcoming. Great location - walked down Charles Street several times to the Public Gardens and Boston Common. Great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: sft233
Reviews.Content: Upon waking up the morning my girlfriend found a cockroach in the shower. We called the front desk and while they were helpful in disposing of it (I could have done this myself), they had nothing else to say other than that this "happens when they are doing construction". The employee also let us know that the cockroaches come up through the drains. If this is in the fact the case, it would make sense to have designed the drains such that they could not fit through them. In any case, other than this situation, the hotel was average. Would have been better had it not been for the cockroach.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel...no, a perfect place to stay...definitely”
Reviews.Author: jelijo
Reviews.Content: To do a proper review you have to remember that there is no such thing as a perfect hotel, they all have flaws. It all depends on what you are looking for in a place to stay. Remember, its a temporary place to stay. Too many people want everything perfect. However no such place exists. We definitely had problems with our first room but the hotel staff was quick to solve any problems and when they couldn't, they moved us to the executive floor. The rooms could use an upgrade, but were always clean and made up quickly. The real gem here is the staff. They are the best, always friendly and willing to help solve any problem. The hotel's second bonus is its outdoor pool, something most Boston hotels lack. The hotel's third bonus is its location, easy walking distance to many sites including Boston Common, the Theatre District and Long Warf. I would recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel52
Reviews.Content: For us the location was perfect. We could walk everywhere. We considered the hop-on-hop off bus but decided to save our $80 and just walk. We were on the 14th floor--executive level which included a continental breakfast. The room was fine (bathroom small but clean) but the furnishing really needed updating for an executive floor. Very quiet at night. We used the pool a few times and it was nice...but since it is outside it wouldn't be useful if the weather was bad. The hotel is right next to Massachussets General Hospital and a Whole Foods and CVS down the block. The front desk people were very helpful and friendly. Not crazy about the $40 parking fee per night but it is similar to othere large cities.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, "Beacon Hill", but feels miles away.”
Reviews.Author: kristigessler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in June. We won't do that again. Location was OK - but you are right across from Mass General - so there are ambulances all day long (although nights were fairly quiet). The other reviews are correct: the furniture and decor are outdated and shabby. The bathroom was so small - very hard to fit two people in it at all. The room was small as well. We pulled up, and had no help with our luggage, despite the obvious struggle and doormen / valets milling about. It is true that you are right on the cusp of Beacon Hill, but you feel miles away. The pool is outdoor - so no good for bad weather. The workout room is minimal, at best. We know Boston hotels are pricey, but we would have preferred to pay more for a better hotel, and will do that next time. Once upon a time, Holiday Inns were a good family hotel, but as I talk with others, we agree that we are steering clear, unless they are a Holiday Inn Express hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff but rooms need updating.”
Reviews.Author: ThorsMom
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel staff - everywhere in the building. The furniture was very old and in disrepair. The bathroom was very small and shabby and the lobby was small. Once again, I must compliment the friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but shabby”
Reviews.Author: thegormandizer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in downtown Boston, near to everything. The staff was wonderful. They were professional, friendly and attentive. The room was fairly good size, and had the usual appointments and It was very clean . The air conditioning worked well, which was great considering it was in the 90's during my trip. The bed was very comfortable, but the pillows left something to be desired. They had pillows labled as "soft" and other labled as "firm", but you really couldn't tell the difference. I called for better firm pillows, and someone came right away, but the pillows weren't any firmer than the ones I had. The furniture looked like it was picked up at a consignment shop. It all had scrapes and gouges and looked like the finish was gone almost all over the front and sides. It was pretty shabby. I traveled here with several colleagues, and they all reported the same shabbiness with the furniture, as well as the pillow situation. The bathroom, although very clean, smelled very musty and moldy. There was breakfast avialable, which was very nice. Aside from the few negatives, this wasn't too bad a place to stay in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Good location but executive room was far from an executive - very tired decor.”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear1717
Reviews.Content: We upgarded to an executive but should have saved the money! When we first entered the room we noticed one of the closet doors was missing and the ceiling near the window looked like it would collaspe at any moment - very tacky. Mentioned these to the front desk, they said it would be fixed - it never happened. Most of the front desk staff was surly and not very helpful, with the exception of Patrice who was delightful. We called the front desk at 10:15 to ask what time breakfast finished, we were told 10am but later found out it was 12 - so much for the breakfast coupons we were given. Self service laundry facilities were out of order for 3 days.... Having said all of this, it is a great location and the beds were very comfortable!!! Will look at other options before I return

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the MGH”
Reviews.Author: DHK44
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is very close to the Massachusetts General Hospital and a large variety of restuarants, also the Charles Street Subway stop. While it lacks the scenic aspects of places closer to the Harbor and Quincy Market, or Harvard Square, it is a well-kept hotel and is certainly ideal for people having any business at the MGH.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rainyday3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the hotel's "executive suites" for two nights. I dropped off the rental with the valet parking staff out front, had a very swift check-in and proceeded to the 12th floor. When I needed the car, I would cal 15 minutes in advance and they'd bring the car around. I'd read about the hotel being noisy but despite one of the nights being a potentially decisive Game 6 of the Stanley Cup playoffs, it was very quiet. The room included a complimentary breakfast, which was typical - fruit, cereal, porridge, breads, yogurt, OJ, tea and coffee. The toaster didn't work very well, but hotel toasters never do. The restaurant is well organized and the service was good. The room came with free wireless Internet, which worked well. The bed was really comfortable and there was lots of hot water in the shower. Downsides: - no bathrub - room was freezing cold... Hotel is close to the State House, Boston Commons and many other attractions. It is also close to a local hospital, so lots of the clientele are either patients or visiting patients. It is also fairly close to Logan Airport but you don't hear any of the air traffic. Overall, I thought it was a little too expensive, especially with $40/day valet parking, but otherwise, a perfectly satisfactory place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: brunoTN
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at that hotel. great location, close to Quincy market and city center. large rooms. bad smell in the room. service is fine. Frank at the Bar is a nice Guy. will come again for the location..

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pat767
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this hotel were: a) the free wifi - even though speeds on our iPhones were in the range of old 56k modems; b) the location was close to two of the trolley tours stops. For the price we paid (~$150) we would've had the Hilton back home. I guess the location (upscale Boston area) is what affects price at this hotel. The hallways smelled really musty; it was horrible. The rooms were really dated, with small old Zenith TVs and tiny bathrooms where the paint was chipping all over the ceiling. Not to mention the size of the bathrooms: you had to slide yourself between the toilet bowl and the countertop just in order to close the door! There was about 1/2" clearance between the door and the front of the toilet bowl. Also beware: parking is ridiculously expensive at $40 per day. That's what lunch for two costs in an average restaurant! Impossible to park in the smaller streets as they are reserved to residents of the area. If you're lucky and you find a spot, you can park on the main street for free on Sundays. Would probably book in another location and get better value for money. Book somewhere in the outskirts near a subway station; you can get around for $1.70 in the subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good, but room was filthy”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: I can say for a fact that I've never been given a hotel room this dirty before. Since the hotel was "sold out", there was nothing they could do to offer me a better room apparently. The bathtub was dirty and I refused to take a shower, so I really am glad I was only here for a short time. And $40/night for parking was totally ridiculous! This hotel is overpriced. I usually stay at the Courtyard Marriott when I'm in Boston, but this hotel was a bit cheaper so I tried it...let's just say I'll never stay here again. The only plus for me was the location - it's walking distance to many restaurants and shops (but, then again, so are lots of other hotels.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: itaewandong
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for location as you can get any where riding the T (Boston Subway). It is a more economical hotel but a tired one. The beds are fine so you get a good night sleep but the walls are paper thin so you can hear everyone inside and out. The bathrooms are small. Boston us expensive and this hotel is cheaper. At least there is a Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but getting a little worn.”
Reviews.Author: Lotionistic
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and she had a conference for 1 day at Mass General (MGH). The hotel common areas and the rooms were perfectly fine, but the room could use some updating soon. The BA was tiny, but functional. The BA door had apparently been wet many times b/c the bottom of it was coming apart. The other worn area was the dresser - reminded me of a thrift store find. Exc location for what we wanted to do. About 3 blocks from the Charles/MGH train station and within walking distance (< 1mi) of Boston Common and historical stuff. Plenty of restaurants nearby to walk to as well as a Whole Foods. Never did eat in the HI restaurant and ate b'fast most days at the Au Bon Pain in the corner of the HI bldg complex. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “fine location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilandBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a group of 40 to run the 115th Boston Marathon. Short trip from the airport. Fast check in - very friendly and efficient staff. Room was typical city medium priced hotel. Clean and with all the facilities you need, but a smallish room and slightly tired. Comfy bed with nice pillows. Coffee machine and small fridge. not a great view, but city centres rarely are. The room was quiet and we slept as well as we could considering the jet lag and the race to come!! Small bathroom - the door hit the toilet when opened, but clean and with a good shower and lots of toiletries. The big plus for this hotel is the location. Within a few minutes walk of the harbour ,all the old parts of town and the Freedom trail, and a number of underground stations. The underground pass was $15 for 7 days. We used it a lot in our 5 days. You can only get a 1 or 7 day pass, but at $15 it is very good value, even though we only stayed 5 days. The underground goes to all of those places just a bit too far to walk to. Harvard, MIT, Copley Square, Fenway Park etc. Just behind the hotel is a great food supermarket, with a nice eating area.Everyone had breakfast there. No one we knew ate in the hotel for breakfast or dinner. Don't know what the hotel food was like, but so many other places to eat within a short walk. Handy liquor store just across the street. The reception staff and concierge were really helpful in giving us directions. There is a safe deposit box room near reception. No charge, but a charge if you lose the key. We had no complaints with this hotel. Just what you expect from a city centre hotel, no frills but good location. Neil

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MariaJM1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was comfy and very nice. The staff are kind and helpful. The only bad point is that from our room you can hear the lifts when the TV is off. The shower is also not very powerful but ok. We would def stay here again and would reccommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Was at Msss. General”
Reviews.Author: ElsieH2
Reviews.Content: We were treated very good by everyone we met. They where very good to us. It made our stay there a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Average accomodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CAN500
Reviews.Content: Great location at base of Beacon Hill....great for walking & sightseeing. Staff was fine...recommended places for dinner. Wood furniture in rooms very scruffed up.....bathroom was very small.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't sleep at all”
Reviews.Author: mattnewby04
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel...my wife and I were flying out of Logan airport very early the next morning and decided to stay in Boston instead of drive in. Upon arriving at the hotel, the staff was not friendly at all. After confirming our reservation we were handed a key and...that was it. No direction to the elevator, no "enjoy your stay". My wife and I made it to our room. It was a double room instead of the king bed room we had reserved. Instead of asking to be changed, we just went to sleep. At 2 AM, we were woken up by an argument on the street outside of our window that turned into a fist fight between a couple. We had to call the police for fear of the woman's safety. Once back asleep (at 3AM because of the police lights and arrest outside our 3rd floor room) we were awoken at 4AM by several drunken people banging on the walls in the hallway and being obnoxious. Finally we left the room at 5AM to get to the taxi. When checking out we stood at the counter for several minutes waiting for the desk clerk who was watching television in the back room (we had called to say we were on our way down to check out). FInally, after all of that, the ATM in the hotle didn't work which caused problems when it came time to pay our taxi driver. We should have just stayed at home and driven to Logan in the early morning...we would have gotten more sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishing- Buffet breakfast inedible”
Reviews.Author: mtnwen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here frequently, as it is close to MGH. The rooms need total refurbishing- torn upholstery, worn furniture. The buffet breakfast was $36 for two- the eggs were inedible, as was the bacon. The fruit was average to below- interesting as there is a Whole Foods right behind this hotel where the fresh fruit is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff were great!”
Reviews.Author: Ksenior
Reviews.Content: We had read some reviews criticizing the staff at the Holiday Inn in Beacon Hill. We found it to be the complete opposite. My husband and I were having trouble with the printer in the business center and the staff printed out our documents at the front desk and then faxed the for free. When we offered a tip, the staff refused to take it. The staff also recommended a great little Italian restaurant around the corner, Antonio's. This was a perfect dinner after a long drive up from Philadelphia. The hotel location was also great so we will be sure to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at a lot of Holiday Inn's”
Reviews.Author: Redsox1988
Reviews.Content: Went to the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill for New Years eve, but please first take noteI never read reviews prior to going to the hotel only after. The location is simply amazing and would most likely return to this hotel because of that. I arrived at the hotel around 4pm, the desk seemed fulled staffed and only one person in line. They had a seperate line for PC members, which I am, but decided to go in the opposite line, The clerk behind the PC line had one hand on her hip staring at the guest in front of her like he did something wrong, When I arrived at the desk I was asked " Name" , your room is not ready, she looked over at the gentleman next to her and said " He's the one doing the due outs", Umm what does that mean?? I waited for about 1/2 hour and was placed on a floor " PC " floor, You had to use a key to get to this floor, a tad bit snobby if you ask me, Rooms were small, had to open the door in the bathroom to get it, close it to use the bathroom, and the door hit every time I opened it, Rooms was nicely equipped with a Flat Screen, Gamecube, Fridge, and my favorite MOUTHWASH!!!, Beds and Linens were that of a typical Holiday Inn. The two best parts of the hotel were the dining Breakfast was great and the waitress was oustanding, Also the Bellman, sounded to have a Jamican accent was excellent as well. Would good back for the location if I need to visit Mass General or Quincy Market, if not save a couple buck a hop the train to Newton where there is a nice Crowne Plaza and Hotel Indigo

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTravler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location, directly next to Mass General, Shops and about 3 Blocks from Quincy Market. Check in I was a bit set back when i arrived around 330 and was met by a sturdy, "Your room isnt ready yet!!", after about an hour my room was ready, nice, clean, Fridge and Micro, Walk in shower, A little smaller than a usual hotel room, but expected in the city. Nice flat screen TV's with On Demand Movies. Again, hate to emphasize of location but it was excellent. Ihad a very loud wedding party on the floor that kept on partying.The best part of the hotel was the dining, FREE Full Breakfast in the AM with a wonderful waitress who despite having plently of other co workers seemed to be doing it all by herself, my hats go off to her,she was picking up the slack for others, wish i could remember her name. Ate dinner to there and it was decent. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave014
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel when I last stayed there, maybe 15 years ago. Alas,it has not aged well. On the plus side, the hotel is a short walk from downtown, is convenient to the subway, and is a short cab ride from Logan Airport. Like others, I appreciated the nearby Whole Foods store, and there are coffee shops and restaurants too within easy walking distance. The bedding was new and comfortable, and I got a very good rate on short notice. The disappointments, however, were significant. My room was depressing: the furniture was worn, the TV was a relic of a bygone era, and the carpet was dusty. Strangely, the bathroom door would not open fully. It banged into the toilet! Breakfast was included in my rate (another plus) but the food was marginal and with one exception the staff were quite indifferent to the guests. I travel frequently on business. I think this hotel is OK for a short visit but not up to par for a major chain. Is a renovation on the horizon?

Reviews.Title: “needs updating ..pricey..”
Reviews.Author: breingan
Reviews.Content: room was tired and scuffed up , veiw was great ..has a whole food market out the backdoor ..staff at front desk less then friendly..no concierge on weekends ..I have paid less for more in boston...so probally would not go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect luxury!”
Reviews.Author: ElizBC
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm not the type of person who regularly writes negative reviews. i dislike reading reviews obviously written by a cranky person I try to find something nice to say about each hotel....but this one had more negatives than positives. I got a good deal on a room on priceline...but, they only had king beds available when we arrived. The woman at the front desk told us to just "put a pillow between us" and we'd be fine. Sure, kind of funny....I guess. Next she checked us into a room on the second floor. Turned out to be a nice, large room, but then we noticed the bathroom did not have a door! Even more appalling, when I called down to the front desk (assuming she didn't know the room was in the middle of maintenance or something), she said "yes, ma'am I am aware there is no door," and sounded put out when I asked for a change of room. When we finally were in our second room, all was fine. We were across from the elevators, but after the other problems, we decided to live with it. The rooms were clean and so were the bathrooms. A little older looking, but not run down. The bathroom door hits the toilet and doesn't open all the way - maybe that is why the first room didn't have a door any longer?:) I stayed here on a previous occasion and enjoyed it, so I do still recommend it with a caveat - only stay here if you get a great deal and will only be using it for a bed. If you want service and luxury, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Chosen only because of location”
Reviews.Author: nbjuls
Reviews.Content: It's a great location if you are heading to the TD garden. Only about 5 mins walk. I booked thru the hotel itself so yes I paid full price for the room. Very expensive, however we did have a executive floor, and from what I read on here it's way better then the normal floors. It was quiet on our floor, had a nice fridge, king size comfy bed. The bathroom is so small, the decor is outdated, and room a bit banged up. The front desk staff left something to be desired in my opinion. I do travel often and never felt this way when I checked in. Not friendly, I felt stupid asking some questions, I think maybe it was just one person but shouldn't be that way if you are going to work at the front. I got to the room to realize you needed a password for internet use, i did call down and the girl who answered was nice. I parked my car myself because of the service I got when I checked in. I refused to use valet, I parked it where I could see it from my room( in the whole foods parking) it worked out fine because I did not need to use the car so you still pay 40$ for the night but worked out well for me. I am not sure I would stay again. I am hoping to get back to Boston to really sight see and maybe see an event at the Garden, but might look at other hotels around first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcoop99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beacon Hill Holiday Inn during a long weekend in Boston. This was the perfect location for all downtown Boston activities. The subway station was only two blocks away but we were able to walk to almost every attraction throughout the downtown area. Booked on Priceline for a great price so it's hard to complain. Room was clean and well taken care of each day. Staff was friendly but we are low maintenance travelers. My only major complaint is why other hotel guests feel it is okay to make so much noise in the hallways after 11:00 pm. Natalie at check in was very accommodating, Thanks for the upgrade. It made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “don't ask for a 'to-go' box”
Reviews.Author: kalileahmp
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was spacious, water pressure was good, the location was walking distance to the TD Garden. Expect to pay about an arm and a leg, to make up for the reasonable hotel price, on parking. $40 valet overnight. Welcome to Boston. My husband went downstairs to get me breaksfast while I was getting dresses and they refused and even mocked him in regards to a to-go plate. He walked past the counter and he heard them mocking him again. Even after he called them out, they did nothing to rectify the situation. Location is fabulous, room was good, but thats about all you'll get.

Reviews.Title: “We got an upgrade to an Executive Suite,cant argue with that!”
Reviews.Author: pamdc43
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were given an upgrade which was great.14th floor,fabulous views. The hotel was a short walk to a huge Whole Foods market where we shopped and ate at the cafetaria.What an amazing place,we've nothing to compare in NZ. We used cabs a fair bit to get to shops and attractions a bit further afield.Boston is a classy city with a rich history this was my third visit,hope it's not my last.My one complaint about the hotel is they have a policy of not holding luggage,we'd left a suitcase at Mystic and wanted it delivered to the hotel,we didnt get to see it again until we got to Eastham!

Reviews.Title: “Two different hotels”
Reviews.Author: ki1983
Reviews.Content: My friend is a priority club member and he got this beautiful room up on the top floor with great view of boston, nice flat screen a big fridge and free breakfast the room was great, and you even needed a key to get up to the floor, Very Nice..... But my room was not on that " Special Floor" I had a room next to some sort of hospital , vending machines and a buisness center, no fridge, no flat screen, different colors in rooms, smaller bathroom i means room was clean but I am a Priority Club member and we paid sames rate and it was too different hotels. Maybe i'd go back if i make a higher priority club level to make them recognize

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChessiePeake
Reviews.Content: Reading the last couple of reviews I wondered if this was the same hotel I stayed in. Like a previous reviewer this stay was booked using points and was also upgraded to the 14th and a junior suite. No complaints - large bedroom, large bath/shower room with jacuzzi. and separate seating area with a dining table for six. Shower pressure was low but acceptable. All downstairs staff were friendly and helpful both check-in and departure. There is valet parking or you can park in a local car park. There were valets / porters to unload the car and take the luggage to your room. Our flight was not until 8pm but we were able to store our luggage in a room set aside for this purpose. This gave us the whole day to sightsee without bags. It is in a good location, walkable to many locations including Charles Street and the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Do not follow the directions for the hotel that are on the website”
Reviews.Author: Gaskellv
Reviews.Content: Please call the hotel fordirections if you are driving to this hotel or google it. We drove for 2 hours trying to follow the directions on the hotel's website. Beacon Hill is a beautiful neigbourhood........recommend it for the area once you get rid of your car. But the hotel is very aged and needs a lot of upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MossyBeacher
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel we've stayed in, it's a bit tired, but certainly above average, clean and functional. Positives: it is just 2-3 blocks from all the subway lines, it is within easy (10 - 15 minute) walking distance to all the sights and downtown neighborhoods and restaurants. We walked everywhere and seldom needed a cab. Negatives: they lack a concierge but staff is pretty knowledgeable and friendly. We were there a little over a week and after eating wonderful but heavy dinners for 6 nights we found welcome relief from the Whole Foods next to the hotel. Easy and cheap cab ride from Logan.

Reviews.Title: “I should have slept in a tree house”
Reviews.Author: mdale868686
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Boston and took a chance with this hotel. Room had many issues: Holes in the walls bath tub would clog up once you turned on the water (terrible drainage) water pressure dropped to nothing when someone else used the bathroom walls shook and hot water dropped as well toilet was 6 inches off the ground and felt like i was sitting on a soup bowl

Reviews.Title: “Good location and stay, would go back...”
Reviews.Author: canesfan2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days over Labor weekend. No issues with the hotel. I checked-in and was given a free upgrade to executive floor 14, and had mini-fridge in room. I am Platinum with Intercontinental hotels and used my points to book this stay so was really grateful for the upgraded room. I also got free breakfast for my fiancÃ© and I for the 2 days we stayed there. One day was for the continental and one for hot breakfast. Breakfast was great, even continental as it had variety or cereal, pastries, muffins, fruits, and yogurt. The hotel has 4 elevators since there was never a long wait for it. We had a great view of west Boston, which included the river and could even see the famous Citgo sign that is right next to Fenway Park. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Subway, 15 to bars, and 20 to Little Italy, so easily accessible to nearby attractions. Hotel has free wifi, business center with a couple of computers and outdoor pool. We went to pool and the deep-end is actually 8 feet so it was great to actually swim and tread water in a pool! We checked-out on Sunday, and since our flight was not until Sunday evening, we were able to leave our bags at the hotel and pick them up late afternoon. So thatâ€™s nice of the hotel to do that. Overall no problems with hotel and would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Biz Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Platna
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from Mass General, you're a 10-minute walk from the north side of the Commons, a little longer to Faneuil Hall and a $10 cab ride to Fenwick. This is a typical business-oriented hotel. The rooms are normal size, the beds are comfortable. The bathroom has been recently renovated but not the rooms themselves. Our room was clean and there were plenty of towels. Service was good - we got early check-in and they answered all of our questions promptly. There is free WiFi and an seasonal outdoor heated pool (neither of which we used but they're nice to think about). The bar/restaurant was mostly empty at night and there is nothing to do in the immediate area. But cabs pass by every few seconds and they can call a car service if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Decided to Cut my Vacation Short 2 days”
Reviews.Author: Dmerks
Reviews.Content: I went up to Boston and this was honestly the only hotel I was able to book for the stretch I wanted to stay. Let me go on first to say my entire floor smelled like ciggarettes. I am not one to complain but damn. I walked into my room to think this isn't so bad only to find when I tried to open up the bathroom door It hit the toilet. If I was not drinking the whole time I was up in Boston I would of left the first night I was there. Alcohol plus a door hitting the toilet was apparently very funny to me at the time. I paid up front using the priceline lock it in feature. Let me tell you something. I do not regret losing 300 dollars for leaving early. That was the best decision I ever made. Avoid staying here if you can. If you can't you can't it's no roach motel it's just not ideal especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near T stop and Faneuil Hall”
Reviews.Author: chicagolouis
