Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I was there for business, but I checked out the pool. The T stop is one block away and Faneuil Hall is 1/2 a mile. The room was large, and there was a free internet room. (wifi was included free too)

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Shazra
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill. As we had paid almost $300 per night I was expecting more than we got. The rooms need to be updated, i.e. decor and amenities. A flat screen TV would be good. One problem was that we were unable to open the door to the bathroom fully as it clashed with the toilet, and hardly enough room to turn around. The staff were quite friendly but breakfast was exactly the same every day. There was no fridge in the room either, which is something I would have expected in this day and age! The location of the hotel was pretty good, although it was directly opposite the Genereal Hospital, but the trolley card stopped directly outside. I doubt I would stay here again, as I expected much more for my money and room service was really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DianeWoodstock_IL
Reviews.Content: Did not have one problem with this hotel. Our family reserved two rooms and we had three people in each room. Our floor was very quiet. The bathroom is very small, but served its purpose. Rooms could be updated, but still a nice hotel. We were there to site see so we didn't spend much time in the room. The beds were comfortable. We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and were able to check into our rooms early. Restaurant prices are very high, but there are many restaurants around there for eating. The front desk even gave suggestions. There is a great restaurant at the corner for breakfast, Au Bon Payne. The location is great. Transportation is close and a lot of attractions are in walking distance. Had elderly parents traveling with us and they had no complaints. Would recommend this hotel for leisurely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Us”
Reviews.Author: juliebergman
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of the negative reviews and must say none of that applied to our trip. We were greeted nicely by the front desk staff, they even gave us a fridge at no additional charge for our room when I asked. Rooms were clean. The two times we used the pool it was clean as well. Great location near a blue, green and red line station. Whole Foods and CVS right behind the hotel. Our room had a great view of the Charles River, Prudential Building and the John Hancock Tower. Not a lot of good restaurants right there, but with a short walk or T ride you can get to anyplace.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday Inn Ever”
Reviews.Author: baokunyi
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill is the worst Holiday Inn that I have ever stayed at. My room was located across from the worst 3 things it could be: elevator, ice machine and soda machine. The elevator beeps when it reaches the floor, the ice machine + soda machines sound like an earth quake outside the door. Everytime someone walked passed our door, we heard them. Everytime somone used the ice machine, we heard it. Everytime someone got a soda, we heard it. The best was the people returning to the hotel at 4am stumbling down the hallway loud enough to wake us up. The air conditioner makes a sound everytime it comes on or off, which is about every 5 minues. I waited 15 minutes for the elevator in the morning. The bathroom is so small, that the door can't open the whole way. The door hits the toilet everytime it opens. The hotel is old, the beds are "full" size, the tv's are old tube 19"s, the headboards are cracked, the wall paper is coming off the wall, our closet was missing a mirror door, the walls are paper thin, there is nothing to do at 10pm around the hotel, the bathroom is insanely small with no fan. With all my travel, this was one of my worst experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: Downtown hotel, a 10 minute walk to Quincy Market, close to Mass General. Staff were polite and efficient, and while our room did overlook a parking lot, it wasn't a big deal. Quiet property overall, and really comfortable beds. Ahhh. Parking was 36 a night for valet, or 40 to self park, so figure that into your costs.

Reviews.Title: “PATHETIC”
Reviews.Author: toby495
Reviews.Content: One of the WORST hotel stays I have EVER had!. Staff was rude. If you asked for something they treated you like you were inconveniencing them and they were doing you a favor. Business center consisted of two very old and slow desktops. Pool area was filthy. 2/3's of the rooms have either a parking lot or next door building view .Don't waste your time. Definitely not worth the $$$!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location...but what is with the staff?”
Reviews.Author: GAndersGardens
Reviews.Content: I don't think there is a better location for a hotel than on Blossom Street in Beacon Hill area of Boston. Close to history...good views... Withe exception of our check-in bellman, Robin at the front desk and one of the housekeeping staff, the entire rest of the staff had a surliness that is usually created by a poor management staff. Too many good restaurants locally to take a chance on the in house dining experience. Good value for the valet parking and the local Whole Foods Market is the best I have ever experienced. THAT was a fun experience in itself! As long as you do not have any major problems where you might need some assistance from hotel staff and can overlook some neglection in public area cleanliness I would say this is the spot. This is NOT a boutique hotel. This is not the best example Holiday Inn has to offer. That is unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights whilst at a work meeting at Mass General Hospital next door. Check-in was efficient and friendly. My room was on the Priority Club floor (11th?) and was well appointed. The room itself was large with two beds but the bathroom was very small - the door wouldn't open fully as the toilet was in the way! The decor was pretty dated particularly in the bathroom but the shower was hot and powerful and the whole room was clean. There was free, fast, wireless internet access in the room and communal areas. The area is great - as well as the hospital there are plenty of local shops, bars and restaurants. There are two subway stops (on different lines) within five minutes walk. It's not the most exciting hotel I've stayed in, but it is clean, well located, efficient and good value. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephmark08
Reviews.Content: We were totally Boston Virgins and we really hit the jackpot with this hotel. If you are unsure where to stay and you don't mind walking a 3 block hill (hey excercise is good) and if you don't want to spend $400 a night this is the perfect hotel. This is honestly in the perfect location, you are not in the middle of the city but you are still only 3 blocks away from everything. We could walk everywhere...the public garden, cheers, quincy market, the government center T entrance is right there, which will take you anywhere else. We went to Fenway, TD garden (where Celtics play), The Aquarium(not too impressed), and stopped at a lot of little pubs and shops. I would not stay anywhere else...honestly you will not be dissapointed unless you were not planning on walking in Boston and in that case don't go to Boston :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveStefan
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with this hotel. Its was in a great location - a short walk to the city centre and down stairs was a Whlefoods store - yummy

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, not fancy but did the trick”
Reviews.Author: fsu23phd
Reviews.Content: A great place to start your exploration of Boston. 4 blocks to city hall (and another short walk to Quincy Market). If you take Joy street, it's about a 10 minute walk to Boston Common. It is right next to a Whole Foods, a CVS and a Bank of America. The only tricky part was parking. The Valet asked for $36/day. I said I would park myself and he directed me to a garage attached to the building, which cost $32/day. I saw another parking garage a block away from my hotel room, so I parked there 1 night. That garage belongs to Mass General Hospitable, so I figured it'd be cheap, but it was $40. The room was unremarkable, comfortable but not fancy, and a little small. But for the deal I got, it did the trick. I would stay there again. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located, but run-down; service could be much better”
Reviews.Author: MariaGGG
Reviews.Content: This hotel left me with mixed feelings. I wouldn't recommend it and I expect more for Holiday Inns, in general. The location is very nice, in many ways, but the hotel feels run-down and service leaves much to be desired. Initially, I was irked by _very_ slow check-in ( more than 1/2 hour!) with staff not all that polite and helpful at all, and a run-down feel of the room, as well as the weirdly designed bathroom with in-your-face door. As I stayed in the hotel for a bit longer, I started to appreciate the location, and the proximity to all the things that are nice to have next to the hotel -- a pharmacy, a tavern, a coffee store, a bank. The room was clean, too, which was more important to me than the run-down feeling. So it was growing on me. And then came the check-out. At check-out, I couldn't get a hold of a luggage cart, and had to spend tons of time waiting for the bellboy to put my luggage into storage. Again, had to talk to the registration desk stuff, where one person was helpful and nice, and another one -- not at all. Having spent 1/2 hour at check-in, I was forced to spend another 1/2 hour at check-out ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: annetxa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn overnight and I have nothing, but positive things to say about the hotel. The room was clean, everyone was so very helpful, and everything was in order. I had to keep my car in the parking garage a little later and that wasn't a problem with the hotel. I did have to pay a little extra for the time spent in the parking garage, but to me it was worth it. I do suggest eating somewhere else because the food at the hotel is kind of expensive and nothing special. This hotel is also very accessible to the subway and other amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to spend time in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Give My First Born for Food”
Reviews.Author: HeavenCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful, neat and clean. The staff were not so friendly. No where in the rooms or at the restaurant (Fosters) did it say how much the breakfast buffet was. When we asked, I almost fell off my chair. ($16.95). All we had was coffee & english muffins and a small milk. The bill was $26.00 !!! Wow.....and we were still hungry driving to the airport. Also, the amenities stated shuttle service back and forth to the airport; not. When I asked I was rudely told "not at this hotel". Valet parking was $36.00 a day and if you parked yourself, it's $32.00 and if you move your car and come back, it's another $32.00 . Bring your walet. I would never go here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but lack of service and OLD”
Reviews.Author: rofly
Reviews.Content: The positives: safe, great location, close to public transportation and within walking distance of many sights. We were allowed to check in early, which is always nice. Dining options and Whole Foods/CVS nearby. Bathroom size was fine. Negatives: Our room was very old. The dresser drawers were not fitting in properly and all the furniture looked very old. That didn't bother me too much since I got a Priceline deal, but I would have been upset if I paid full price. The phones were NOT working in the room, which I found out while trying to call at 1:30am to report a loud party room down the hall. So I had to call from my cell phone. NOTHING was done about the noise, at least not for the next half hour. I was really upset by that my complaint was not taken seriously on a Sunday night. No excuse for that. I guess the outdoor pool wasn't open yet for the season? I wasn't told that it wouldn't be, nor was there a sign on the door. The pool had water in it but the door to it wasn't open.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff. HOWEVER...”
Reviews.Author: Cricket975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill from 5/20/10 through 5/23/10. It was a combination business/ pleasure trip, as I was doing research for a book I'm writing, plus it was our anniversary weekend. We grabbed a taxi at Logan Airport, and our cabbie congratulated us on our choice of hotels, saying that it was "near everything." We took this to be a good sign. Check-in was a breeze. A pleasant young woman named Sam made us feel very much welcome. She answered our questions before we even asked them, giving us the info we needed to connect to the hotel's wireless network. We requested a mini-fridge in our room. She cheerfully told us that she'd charge us just $20 for our whole stay, not per day. (The fridge arrived about 15 minutes later.) We stayed in Room 1008. From our 10th floor window, we could see the Charles River far in the distance, but mostly our view was of buildings and traffic. The window itself was quite dirty. Our room featured a good-sized closet with a sliding mirrored door. Ironing board, iron, plus an extra pillow inside. Bathroom was small, but clean and functional. Hair dryer was kind of chintzy; I had to hold the "on" button for it to stay on. We had two double beds in our room, which were neatly made and inviting-looking, with four plump pillows a piece. Other furnishings included a writing desk, nightstand, large dresser, armchair, TV, Nintendo Game Cube and four lamps. The desk and dresser were worn-looking; they looked maybe twenty years old. Housekeeping took good care of our needs straightening up our mess and replacing towels and toiletries in a timely fashion. Some minor complaints... our room door was messed up. We had to practically break into our own room to open it. Our beds were too soft. Both of us woke up with achy backs and necks. The hotel restaurant was way too expensive. We got our daily breakfasts at Au Bon Pain (this is housed in the same building as the hotel, although you have to exit the hotel and walk outside to enter the restaurant) every morning. Also, the walls in this Holiday Inn aren't well insulated to keep sound out. You might want to bring ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. We were supposed to get a free newspaper every morning, but only got it one day. Checkout was easy, and again we dealt with friendly hotel staff. This hotel does not offer free shuttle service to the airport, but there are always taxis parked outside. (This will cost you between $16 and $25, depending on the cab company.) Or you can take the trolley and save even more money. Next time we're in Boston, we probably will try a different hotel. Not that this one was bad, but it could've been better.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with real good location”
Reviews.Author: doogha
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful staff with a basic hotel style. The rooms are fine sized with small bathrooms, nice showers and a bathroom door that hits the toilet ( I really didn't believe that several people on past reviews complain about this as a major issue. I told my wife and she couldn't believe people would single that out: but stay for a few days and OMG! it becomes annoying, especially in the middle of the night). The bed was comfortable, the hallways and front desk areas were clean and manicured. We didn't frequent the bar and restaurant but the menus seemed limited but decent: the bar small but cozy. The location of this property was better than I expected. Right on top of Mass General Hosp. the Charles T stop red line is two blocks away: North Station and Hay Market are a mere ten minute walk. There are several bars, restaurants (even Chinese and Mid. East.), liquor store, convenience store and the Charles River Shopping Plaza (Everything you need is within a block or two including the massive hospital and fire department). Parking is $36 a day valet so park outside Boston and ride the T in (get a Charlie and ride the T for $1.70 - this makes your trip much better. You get to be with the people, learn to navigate your way through the age old city set up and see much more than if you drove. Would recommend and stay again. Oh, being a Sox fan it would be nice if the hotel expanded there tv lineup and included NESEN!

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: gogogadget08
Reviews.Content: This was pretty much what I expected after reading the reviews on this site. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were fine. Nothing spectacular, but again, clean and had everything we needed. We were on the 12th floor and it was quiet. I wouldn't have known that some floors were dorms except for reading it here. The location was great. We really enjoyed the Beacon Hill neighborhood. It was a quick walk to most sites and about a 5-10 minute walk to the Red line. We always felt safe in this neighborhood, even late at night. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel within walking distance to harbor and sights”
Reviews.Author: Wolffian
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills Holiday Inn that has obviously seen better days. Certainly could do with some renovations but room was pretty comfortable but small bathroom. Walls were thin in that I could hear people in the next room, fortunately, they kept quiet but I could certainly see possible problems with "noisy neighbors."The staff I met at the desk were incredibly welcoming. Breakfast not too great, would recommend finding another place nearby. Easy walking distance to many tourist attractions including the harbor. Would probably try a more upscale hotel next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutley horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: RLDCIM
Reviews.Content: Hmmm, where do I start? - Terrible check-in process (took 1/2 hour) - Uncomfortable beds - 4 floors are Dorms - The walls are wafer thin - JUNK - We were kicked out while sleeping in the middle of the night by Boston police (at 4am, and given 5 minutes to GET OUT ) because they said that someone from our room was causing trouble. We were not allowed to pleed our case and were threatened to be thrown in jail!?!? We had to find another hotel and check in for the night. Once we returned, the hotel admmitted that it was not our room causing the trouble and apolized. They offered our room back, but were not offered any compensation for our trouble and their misunderstanding. I WOULD NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. We found a MUCH BETTER hotel in this same great area.

Reviews.Title: “close to Celts and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: meganjillb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our extended family for a Celtics game weekend. The hotel was in easy walking distance from the TD Bank Garden and right across the street was a quaint Irish bar and also a fantastic Italian restaurant. We would definitely stay here again on a weekend for a TD Bank Garden event.

Reviews.Title: “Very low three star -- not a bad two star”
Reviews.Author: ctuai
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean but getting worn out. Furniture is dinged and missing handles, overall maintenance is starting to get sloppy for a three star. No bathtubs only showers, our iron and coffee maker didn't work, but was replaced immediately. Older television. Towels getting a little ratty and my wife says they smell like gym towels. Overall a disappointing three star

Reviews.Title: “Good location for hockey fans”
Reviews.Author: DREWson
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston to check out some hockey games and you couldn't ask for a better location. Close enough to walk there but far enough to not be in the middle of the crowds flocking to the TD Bank North. I got a really good deal at $99 on hotwire.com and we found out other people were paying about $300+ at the front desk for the night so really look around online before booking here. I wouldn't pay $300 for a night that is for sure. The rooms are pretty standard rooms. There is a really good pub across the street and drinks are not that pricey. Food is really good as well. All in all, it is a decent place to squat for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient area,rooms kind of old looking”
Reviews.Author: BugletMa.
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready right away and the room was clean.The bathroom was very small and some repairs had been made that were not done very well,bathroom door barely opened past the toilet. Room door was scratch up. This hotel was fine but definitely needs updating. Check in was easy. Breakfast was too expensive. Next time would go elsewhere for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Bonanza at Boston's Beacon Hill Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: LukeyLou2
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay in order to see the sights of Boston. (Plus, I got a great deal through Hotwire for a 4 weeknight stay.) First, I could take the "T" from the airport to within a few blocks of the hotel on the "Blue" line. Then, the "Red" line was a few blocks the other way, next to Mass Gen hospital. You can get everywhere by foot on the "T", almost. I even got to the shrine or arboretae--the Arnold Arboretum--by taking the "Green" line (last stop). Second, my standard room on the 9th floor was very nice--2 double beds, updated decor, small but stylish bathroom. The topper was a very nice view out over the water, especially at night. Third, the staff was professional and cordial when I checked in and out or asked a question. (The concierge didn't seem to know a thing about the well-known towns ringing Boston when I overheard others asking about tours, though.) Fourth, there was a wonderful Whole Foods store with great take out food just across the courtyard/parking lot area. I stocked up on Lara Bars (yum-Key Lime Pie, etc.) and great chocolate to tide me over during my day's sightseeing adventures. Fifth, they had a little computer room where I could print out my boarding pass for my return flight. Sixth, checkout was a breeze. I dropped off my key at the front desk and they said goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will do in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: drlucy007
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights and found room ok but musty smelling. Good service at the restaurant. I arrived at 8.45 pm and room service closed at 9. When I called to order the employee said rather snippily, "you're cutting it a bit close." Salad and soup were OK, but it is amazing that there are three additional charges to the bill, including gratuity, service fee, and one other. Very convenient for Mass. General Hospital and they do have special rates. Thought the MGH $189 rate was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best by far.....”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJJG29
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute business trip to Boston earlier this month and with all the rates in the city being through the roof, I was able to get a relatively good deal at this hotel. Having never stayed at this hotel before, I assumed the location in Beacon Hill would ensure a certain level of quality, but was I wrong. It was a very different level of service. The rooms had a residual smell of smoke with broken down furniture, uncomfortable beds and very little customer service. The only benefit is the location being close to beacon hill, but thats all. The staff is very status quo with nothing but the most simple level of service. I would not recommend this hotel unless you were trying to save several $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day nightmare- three floors of the hotel are dorms!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and started seeing a couple of parents come into the hotel with their college age children. We thought it was sweet that the parents were bringing their children to Boston and staying in the hotel before sending them off to college. Suddenly, the children and their belongings multiplied out of control because the hotel rents out THREE FLOORS as college dorms!! We could not get an elevator and altough the hotel saved one out of four for guests, it was caotic in the lobby and elevators. We had a no-smoking room (surprisingly had to sign papers and everything- we are not non-smoking fanatics ) and suddenly the smell of smoke was so intense in the middle of the night we thought there was a fire. Probably a party. The hotel assured us that we had happened to make reservations in the worst weekend of the year and that the students are never a problem. We have our reservations about that., too many kids around. The location is not in Beacon Hill, but just across the northern boundary, there are plenty of restaurants in the area and a great Whole Food behind the hotel. The hotel has a two-computer internet room (discovered by mistake- were never told and not in the hotel description) and a small laundry as well as a small gym. it also has WiFi. No safes in the room nor refrigerator. It was a confortable, clean room, great bed, with a nice view, but it does need updating, furniture chipped. If you are staying there do find out when spring break is and when classes end. Also if you have a car get a package that includes parking or park it yourself underneath the hotel and Whole Foods instead of the Hotel's valet service-it is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Near the attractions, walk everywhere”
Reviews.Author: UrbanXplorer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, typical Holiday Inn quality (i.e. good) and a great location in that you can walk to major attractions within half an hour! Aquarium, North End, Boston Common... they are all accessible by foot which is great in a city that is horrible for driving. Only crazy thing is that Boston as a whole is not a place to own a car or attempt to drive!! If you bring a car, hotel has valet parking which costs $36/night. Not uncommon in a city where someone paid $300,000 to secure a private parking place on the street!

Reviews.Title: “It is not renovated as it may advertise. Budget hotel with high price.”
Reviews.Author: Welltraveledhottie
Reviews.Content: The new Holiday Inns are great; this is not a new Holiday Inn...dont let the new green sign fool you! The rooms were not ready at check in, stale smell on floor, elevator, dirty carpet, didnt feel like I could EVER take my shoes off, outdated and scuffed up furniture, no amenities....bring your own toiletries! Broken closet and Lock loose on door.....could pull deadbolt off if I tried. Staff terrible the manager wonderful. She really helped to accomodate me. The location is the only good thing about this hotel. Its a dump to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, staff and price.”
Reviews.Author: cctravelerCctx
Reviews.Content: This is a great central location. We had a wonderful large room and an early check in. A room on the opposite side of the hospital is optimal. There is a Whole Foods, CVS, and a bagel resturant a few steps from the hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “parking Terrible and Breakfast buffet less than average”
Reviews.Author: romeeko
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and had very good service with teh Valet but now the valet is aweful.but the front desk is very nice but not helpful with my issue My recomendation is to not use the Valet service unless you need to be goign in and out many times. They use the same parking garge arround the corner and is chaeper to park yourself. well I had 2 issues here. 1. Breakfast buffet was not that good. Not much on the buffet bar and the scrambled eggs were not very warm. This was suprising because I was one of the first people in the brakfast area 2. I parked out front to get checked in. I parked nearby the Valet signa nd came back to my vehcile and had a $50.00 ticket on my car. I was chekcign in a getting Valet. The valet attendent said nothing he could do. The hotel will no do anything. The city of Boston will not do anythign because they say it is in the Taxi stand area. Terrible sighns.

Reviews.Title: “I woke up with bites on my body”
Reviews.Author: Roanke_VAMac
Reviews.Content: Look, mistakes can be made. But something was not right. I a few bites on my body. Could of been a spider, I have no idea. My daughter (5) slept in the bed with me, I checked her over, she lacked any bite marks. I did the mattress check, no signs of discoloration but, just a general reminder keep your suit cases off the floor. Also I know this just sounds a little more crazy but it was the week of the 4th and I had bought a bottle of vino, and keep it in the room to take to the pops concert. A few days later couldn't find it. How does the maid mistake an unopened bottle.? My Jewlerly was fine though. And finally postitive feedback the staff was great. Great location. Pool area looked fun. Whole foods just around the corner! Fantastic! I'm comming back to Boston in a few weeks and I'm going to try somewhere else. PS .Parking was not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: My stay was from June15-18. My husband was there on business, and we decided to make it a family trip. We were assigned a room on the 11th floor. I found the room to be quite large, and just having been to New York, it looked like a whole apartment. The room was clean and comfortable. The only problem was that our room faced towards the hospital side, and we could hear every siren that passed by. But it was nothing major and we could still sleep well. I read some of the reviews about the bathroom, and I guess we all have different standars for what we consider small or large. The bathroom is average size, the same kind of size you find in bathrooms at other hotels. The only problem I had was that the shower/bathtub curtain was not big enough, and water spilled on onto the floor each time we bathed. So with four of us, things got a bit messy. There is a coin machine laundry room for use by guests, which I liked, since traveling with small children equals spilled foods and dirty clothes. You can walk from the hotel to practically anywhere in the downtown area, and there are two train stations nearby. The location of the hotel is excellent. I had breakfast at the hotel with my kids, and I only paid for myself. My kids ate for free. The food was good, and the service was excellent. I did find the front desk to be kind of impersonal, but they were professional and polite. All in all, it was an ok stay, but I might try another hotel if I visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, poor value”
Reviews.Author: adoraelsolNY
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a weekend stay in Boston with two of our friends. We arrived at the Holiday Inn on Friday evening. We parked the car ourselves in the parking garage next to the hotel. Parking was $32 for 24 hours. Check in was easy & quick. We had a room on the 6th floor. The room was small and a bit outdated but the sheets and towels were clean. The bathroom was tiny and there was no ventilation system so the mirror fogged very easily. The only toiletries they provide are shampoo, conditioner and bar soap. I usually expect body lotion to be provided, but it was not a problem because there is a Whole Foods right behind the hotel. The hotel location was great we were in walking distance to a few T stops and the only time we needed to take the T was to get to the Sam Adams brewery which was so much fun. We walked to Quincy Market, the Aquarium & Newbury Street. On friday night we didn't get around to dinner until after 9pm. We found a good sushi place up the street that was reasonable and the food was good. On Saturday we ate lunch at Dick's Last Resort. The food was typical burgers & fries but the staff was very entertaining. We had dinner at Antonio's on Saturday night which is basically right across the street from the hotel. We had to make a reservation for a party of four. Antonio's is very small and it was very busy. The food and service was good and the price was reasonable. All in all Boston was great and the location of the hotel was great but for the price we paid I expected more out of a hotel. If I could get a great price on the hotel I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good compromise between cost and quality”
Reviews.Author: aginga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location for our needs. The rooms were small, and the wallpaper and furniture showed a lot of wear (nicks, smudges, etc.). The bathroom was just big enough and clean. We had two different rooms in this hotel; one was less banged up than the other. We booked through hotwire, and for the discount price we paid I had no problems. Bagel place down the block helped us avoid hotel breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lpfled
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for customer service. The front desk accomodated 2 special room requests even though they were full. The night conciere, Willie, spent lots of time going over best places to eat for different menus, locations and price ranges. He gave us a personal card to give one restaurant and they treated us like kings. We tried several places he recommended and each one far surpassed the ones we read about. There's also a grocery store, liquor store and several pubs within a block, and one of the subway stops is only a couple blocks away. The only drawback is the same as other hotels around Boston - parking fees are outrageous!! It was only a few dollars more to park valet as the parking garage. Next time I won't rent a car, we didn't use it much because everything was closer or accessible by subway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: This hotel met the standards I generally expect of a hotel of this type. It is absolutely nothing special, but no major shortcomings either. I was surprised to note that on Tripadvisor, it was ranked as 60th out of 75 hotels reviewed in Boston at the time I booked. This suggests this hotel is pretty awful, or the other 59 are really good. It didnâ€™t come across to me as deserving this lowly position. It certainly wasnâ€™t awful! I found the staff to be helpful with everything asked of them. I had emailed the hotel telling them we would be arriving late (midnight) and what were the prospects of a light meal at that time. They replied quickly and stated that while Room Service closes at 10pm, they could arrange for a pizza or something similar to be delivered from a nearby restaurant. The location of this hotel was great, and we found ourselves walking everywhere. If you fancy a bus tour of the city, the Gray Line hop on hop off service stops right outside. We were given a room on the Executive Floor (12th floor). The room was fine, although showing some signs of wear and tear, but not to the extent of crying out for a refurb. The important aspects of a clean room, a comfortable bed with everything working was totally met, and the provision of a fridge was welcome. We found that it was quiet, despite being in close proximity to the busy Cambridge Street. The only intrusions were occasional ambulance and fire engine sirens, there being a hospital and fire station close by. The bathroom was a reasonable size â€“ there is no bath, but the walk-in shower formed the length of a bath. However, we prefer showers to baths so we were happy with this. Meals in chain hotels tend to be lacklustre, and this was no exception. We ate in once (room service) only because we were too tired to go out, but regretted it. The meal took one hour to be delivered, although in fairness we did get a call to inform us there was a delay. When it came, one of our meals was wrong, as was the bill. I consider an 18% service charge, a room delivery charge of $4 plus an admin fee of 3 (or 4)% on top to be a bit excessive especially given the circumstances. The hotel deducted $10 off the bill without argument. If you like Italian, I can recommend the Grotto in Bowdoin St â€“ about a 5 min walk from the hotel. Excellent. However, I have to say the breakfasts were fine, with plenty of choice of both cooked, and the â€˜healthyâ€™ option. Service at breakfast was good. As a visitor from the UK, I find it hard to assess whether this hotel represents good value or not what with exchange rates being what they are at present. I cashed in Reward Points for this stay so it didnâ€™t cost anything other than extras; a really nice touch was for Platinum Members receiving free breakfasts. I noted that had I paid, the price would have been $185 per night for the time we were there, which seems expensive â€“ on a par with London UK. Overall, we were happy with this hotel, and if I return to Boston, I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: cathy01013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Memorial Day weekend and got it through Hotwire for $89 for Sunday night. It was worth it. It normally runs $300 a night but I would not pay that. It really is not that classy. It is clean, efficient, close to Faneuil Hall and the T and in a very nice area. We drove to the Alewife Station and parked (cheaper). There are not as many stops and is quicker than using the Riverside station, which we usually do to get to Boston. The attendant at the station however, with the toothpick in his mouth and sun glasses on (we were in a building why(?) sun glasses) and big belly, was rude and unprofessional. Pay attention Mass Transit Authority. When you go there be sure to purchase a 7 day pass at the CORRECT machine, so that you donâ€™t end up purchasing by each trip. This will save you money in the long run if you plan on visiting many places in Boston during your stay, even for a weekend. When we stood at the machine to purchase our tickets, with many people behind us, the attendant approached us and informed us we could not buy a 7 Day Trip. We wanted to ask him more questions, but there were many people that we would hold up and he was being short with us for asking. After all was said and done, I noticed a sign that said we could purchase one day or 7 day pass, which we also read on Trip Advisor. So, I approached him and asked again, he said he never said thatâ€¦. I can understand the confusion and would not been bothered by it if it wasnâ€™t for his lack of courtesy and honesty. So just be aware when you approach the machine, know what you are looking for! If this is your first trip to Boston and you plan on getting around by T and not taxi, the T is the best way and itâ€™s nice to have your fare ready and in hand and is cost efficient to have a fare for more than one or two ways. REDSOX: There was a couple from Chicago that purchased Red Sox tickets from Ace. Be aware when you purchase through ACE they will ask you where you want to pick up your purchase, the couple did not know the area, assumed they would be picking them up at Fenway and had to go to the next town over to pick them up. Scalpers where also at the park selling their wares for more than Â½ face value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: smcharrr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the Sunday before Memorial Day because we had a wedding Sunday evening not far away. Since I knew that we would not arrive until around 2pm, leave for the wedding at 5:30 pm, come back at midnight, and check out at 8:30am to beat the traffic going home, all I wanted was a clean and comfortable place to stay. I got a great discount through Hotwire, and was happy with the selection. The staff was polite and courteous, and checkout and checkin were painless. There were always plenty of cabs in front of the hotel. There is a public parking garage next door (the hotel has no onsite parking) that is not owned by the hotel, but is physically connected to it. I recommend that you park your car yourself if you drive rather than have valet parking. That way you will know exactly where your car is, and you pretty much have 24 hour access to your car in case you need to get something or put something in it. Parking was $32 for 24 hours (and indeed if you were parked for more than four hours). There was free wireless internet in the room, which had aging furniture (chipped and peeling, like you might see at a garage sale), but the beds were very comfortable, the room was a nice size, and it was very quiet, so we got a good night's sleep. We spent about half an hour at the outdoor pool area, which is not large, but had plenty of lounge chairs and a glass enclosure that blocked out most of the street noise, so it was relaxing to sit there. There is a small lobby, but it is not the kind of place that you would want to sit for any length of time. For the price I paid, and the purpose I had, this place was great. It was within a couple of blocks of stores like CVS, Whole Foods, Starbucks, and a really good pizzeria where we had lunch. A few blocks away is a really nice park that we passed in a cab on our way to the wedding. And the Charles Street T is only a 5 minute walk. Beacon Hill itself is a very nice section of Boston (the equivalent of Central Park West and Sutton Place in NYC). If you want a nice place to sleep that is conveniently located when you visit Boston, and don't plan on spending much time at the hotel, then this place is fine. But if you want a hotel where you will want to spend more time (and a lot more money than this place costs), then you need to choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location.”
Reviews.Author: sprizzy
Reviews.Content: I kind of knew a bit of what to expect with the bathroom door hitting the toilet, the less than perfect wallpaper, and the slow elevators, but really!? As long as we feel safe, can sleep, have access to nearby attractions and food, we're good to go. Excellent location, very close to Charles/MGH t-stop. Easy walk to Fanueil/Quincy Mkt. Easy walk to Boston Commons via Charles St. Quick t-rides to Fenway and Harvard. Didn't eat at the restaurant, but hit the Whole Foods Mkt (which I think is a complete nightmare to visit), the nearby coffee shops, and the close beer/liquor stores across Cambridge Ave. If you're a traveller who just wants a place to lay your head, convenient location, nice people, then this is the place. A great welcome to Boston. If you're into luxury, mega bathrooms, and impeccable service... there are other places.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: katmcginty
Reviews.Content: We booked the room before reading this site's reviews, so I had definite qualms when I read the more recent additions. However, we were more than satisfied with the quality of the service and the location. The linens (which are of importance) were very nice (great towels, by the way), and while the room wasn't overly elegant, it only lacked good in-room coffee (it was Maxwell House - no thank you!) The attached restaurant was very nice, although the location is just a nice walk from almost anywhere of interest for us. The employees were delightful, the wireless service was free and reliable, and we really enjoyed our stay. No complaints at all (except for the coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Room dilapidated, service pleasant, good location for Mass General”
Reviews.Author: BobakLives
Reviews.Content: If you have work with the adjacent mega-hospital, Massachusetts General Hospital (I did), the location is excellent. The only other hotel as close to the hospital is a very expensive boutique hotel. The distance from Logan International is surprisingly short; if traffic and construction are in your favor (I arrived after 10:30pm on a Tuesday), the cab fare can add up to $20 plus tip (I was astonished). The hotel is located between two stops on the T (subway), so getting to Cambridge or downtown Boston is easy, as well as other places accessible by mass transit. The staff is friendly at check in, there is a restaurant on-site (didn't get a chance to try it), and a wide variety of restaurants nearby, as well as a grocery store. They have a small fitness center that's free for guests, and a nearby athletic club will offer a $10 day pass with your room key. The rooms are serviced by a below average speed wireless connection, however it is free. Like all Boston hotels, the room prices here are higher than you'd get elsewhere, so I hold back complaints on price knowing that its just the nature of the city (and, as a business traveler, that wasn't my issue). The rooms are not in great shape. Mine was a mish-mash of old and new, mostly old. Lets get the good out of the way: the mattress and linens were good, so was the climate control. The rest of the room was in a state of neglect. The room has clearly been renovated several times, as fixtures and wall molding don't necessarily match the present furniture. The wallpaper was peeling in many places and the furniture was all worn and seriously scratched. The TV was an aging Zenith box. If you're staying at this hotel because you have someone who's at the adjacent hospital, the room will probably not do a good job of cheering you up. On the night I arrived they informed me that the water was being taken offline from 11pm to 5am to fix a problem --again, if you have sensitive health (and this location clearly gets a lot of people visiting the famous hospital), this was not a positive sign. However the hotel was good enough to provide free bottles of water. The poor state of the hotel rooms made me feel the hotel is resting on its location to generate business without any pressure to compete, as most nearby hotels are in a much higher price/luxury class. What a shame. They appear to be trying to make some upgrades, but the only notice I had was they were installing a new Holiday Inn sign --perhaps they should work on the rooms first?

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jackeen2
Reviews.Content: Nice people, clean and attractive hotel, yes. But for me, a number of problems far outweighed those factors. Most serious of which was that, due to severe mobility problems, I had requested a handicapped accessible room. It turned out to be located at the far end of a corridor and a great distance from the elevators. Hence after a very long, very painful walk, I was essentially trapped in the room until checkout. It was simply too daunting a prospect to even try visiting the restaurant or other facilities. Usually, special needs accommodations are situated quite close to elevators/lifts, for what should be obvious reasons. So, it was a shock to be informed that if I needed that proximity, it was up to me to have requested it at the time of booking. Never in my experience in any hotel had I encountered such a situation. Also, while less serious, there were other problems. First of all, although I'd specifically asked for and was promised a mini-fridge at a slight additional charge, none was provided. Then there was the free internet service which, on several attempts to get my my laptop going, kept coming up as having "little or no connectivity." Actually, it was none. Finally, Foster's Restaurant, located within the hotel and from which Room Service originates, was closed for lunch until the 6th of January, in observance of the Holidays. Guests wishing to have lunch had to either leave the hotel for a restaurant or find one which would deliver. Also, the menu was strictly of the meat or seafood variety; any other types of dishes, including vegetarian, had to be special ordered. In sum, I do not plan to stay there again and strongly advise anyone living with a disability to consider the Boston at Beacon Holiday Inn only as a very last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by this hotel! Were given a room on the executive floor so cannot comment on what standard rooms are like - although I would imagine they do not differ much. Spacious room on the 14th (top) floor with an extremely comfortable bed. Huge flat screen TV and good selection of channels as well as movies & games console. Bathroom was a good size with a huge shower - shame there was no bath though! Service in the restuarant was excellent - very attentive staff, friendly and good food available. Location was good - not too far to walk to main city centre. Also close to Beacon Hill area and within walking distance of Cambridge. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “It is not #8 star, never stay”
Reviews.Author: ahtun
Reviews.Content: It is one of worst hotel among "3* hotels" we stayed in our life. We stayed one night. We requested non-smoking room and ended up with smoking room with walking shower. After you took shower, water was draining to room due to leveling on the floor. Rooms and hotel do not seem well maintained, Furniture are very old. Rest room looks not clean. It needs full renovation. I clearly do not recommend to anybody unless you want to be close to hospital for business.

Reviews.Title: “NIce cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikagarwal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on trip to Boston, It was a nice cozy stay, staff was very helpful and welcoming. breakfast was good will go there again for my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyBethlehem_PA
Reviews.Content: We had a room with 2 double beds. Plenty of room for a family of 4. Location is very good. 10 minute walk to Quincy Market and the Freedom Trail. We left our car in the parking garage right around the corner from the hotel and walked everywhere. The kids really loved the Duck boat tour and the Freedom Trail. Decent hotel if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for 85 $ per night”
Reviews.Author: davidli
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights booked through Hotwire.Yes the hotel is a little "older" but when you compare hotel prices in downtown Boston this was a bargain. It was clean ,comfortable, friendly staff, quiet rooms ,free internet and ideally located in the city. There are a few lower floors assigned to Suffolk College students but we didn't encounter any unruly or rowdy behaviour at all. We would definitely stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aljacket
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Boston at Beacon Hill. The hotel was nicely located near two "T" stops, Quincy Market and Beacon Hill. The check-in staff was excellent and was ready to advise us on about Boston and the local area. The rooms were clean and nice sized. Based on my Priority club Status, they upgraded us to the Executive floor, which included a free breakfast buffet. It was good, and the service was friendly. I doubt I would have paid the $13-14 "street" price though, there are enough places near buy that are a better value. We didn't have a car, but parking looked very expensive ($36/day they park, $32/day you park). I am not sure if the parking-lot they used was even owned by the hotel, but not seem to be many other options to park in the area available. There is also a great Italian place Antonio's right across the the street.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Holiday Inn......”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: Well, this is really just another Holiday Inn. Public areas were not fancy but acceptable for a hotel this class, service was just OK, the rooms were kinda dated but comfortable and clean enough. The restaurant did serve a pretty decent breakfast with some really good pastries. Location wise, it's a few blocks away from the nearest "T" Station so there's quite a bit of walking involved.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Haylow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill on 23&24 August. We stay at Holiday Inns fairly often as we as Priority Club members and use our points for free rooms. We were very glad on this occasion that we didn't pay for the room as the price wouldn't have been justified. We were upgraded to an Executive Room, and although clean, it was in need of refurbishment. The bathroom was average, but when we went to use the toiletries we found that they were either empty or half empty and had not been replaced by housekeeping. The a/c was so noisy we had to turn it off in the middle of the night, and because the windows wouldn't open, it was quite an uncomfortable night. Also, at 4 am each morning the hotel must start up the elevators because there was a loud noise of a motor starting and you heard the bell of the elevator every couple of seconds as if it were stopping at each floor. On the plus side, the hotel is fairly well placed in Boston. We got a taxi from the airport and it cost $25. We walked to downtown and the harbour to go on a whale watching cruise, and it only took about 15 minutes to get there (at a slow walking pace). There was also free wifi in the room and although we didn't make use of it a swimming pool and gym. If I had to pay for a room in this hotel, I would look elsewhere for the price, but as we got it free it's hard to be too harsh about it.

Reviews.Title: “good deal in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mathildexl
Reviews.Content: It as a typical Holiday Inn, large room, the furniture a bit worn out with a good rate, which we got, not bad. With the free Internet and the friendly staff at the counter and the bartender in particular even good. Would I stay there again? Yes, if the rate is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: I ended up with this hotel through Priceline's Name Your Own Price and got a great deal - $100 for a one night stay in late July. We drove in from the Mass Pike - it was fairly easy to find, although for a while I thought we were lost and then we drove right up on it. Good location. It's not in the middle of everything, has some very pretty streets and parks a block over along the Charles River, and is walking distance to Government Center & the Science Museum. Rooms were clean, and my son liked the pool - a nice touch that's hard to find in downtown Boston. Front desk staff were nice, and there's an ATM in the lobby. We did valet parking since we were only there for a night - at $36 a day if we were staying longer I would have parked outside of Boston and taken the T in. But we didn't have time to kill, and the gentlemen working the valet were friendly and helpful with directions. Room was average size, as well as the bathroom. Nothing to right home about, but we were only there to sleep so it suited us perfect. We were there for the Sunday brunch in the restaurant downstairs - the buffet was pretty impressive with the amount of food that they had, although I found the food a little to cafeteria tasting, but the price was very reasonable. Coffee came in your own carafe, and they even came buy with to-go cups when we were done. Overall, you're not going to get pampered at this hotel - but if you're looking for the basics, a nice atmosphere, and a clean stay near most Boston attractions, you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay with good location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: MiamiAL
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Beacon Hill is a good hotel at at good location. It is close to both the Government Center and Bowdoin (closed on weekends) T stops, and walking distance to most everything that a tourist would want to see in Boston. An added bonus is that there is a Whole Foods and a CVS pharmacy directly behind the hotel. The downside of the hotel is that there is no fridge in the room, and the parking is $36 a day. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At Holiday Inn Beacon Hill”
Reviews.Author: D&MUpnorth
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk person was very helpful and he upgraded us to an executive room on the 12th floor because we were staying for three nights. We didn't argue. The room was great. It was a good size and the bed and pillows were comfortable. We really enjoyed staying here because of the location as we were able to walk to many areas and the T (subway) was close by as well. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel - very expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: glandsb500
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on business, so I am giving this review from a business travel perspective. This is a typical Holiday Inn offering the typical amenities such as a breakfast room serving either buffet or a-la-carte meals. The buffet is somewhat basic for it's price at $13.00, but then the selections from the menu are also quite expensive, so at the end of the day the buffet is better value than the menu. The rooms are your typical Holiday Inn type room, there was plenty of space and also a king bed. Complimentary high speed internet was also provided. There are no fridges in the rooms. As business hotels go, it was fine. But here is the kicker - parking in downtown Boston is at a premium and this hotel is no exception. The only convenient parking was valet parking at $36 per night! I looked around but could not find any safe parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good deal”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: We only needed a room for 1 Friday night in Boston and didn't really care about where, so we booked through Hotwire and ended up getting this hotel at a room rate of $89, which was great compared to the going rates at other nearby hotels. When we arrived we were happy to see that there was a parking garage attached to the hotel, where you can pay for public parking (at $32 for 24 hours) or also use a valet option with in-and-out privileges. Very convenient options! The exterior of the hotel was much better than I have seen at other Holiday Inn's. It is also in a good location...lots of options within walking distance, such as Boston Commons and Quincy Market. When we arrived, the desk clerk was very helpful in making sure we knew where we were going and had maps and such to go with us. We were also surprised to find out we were upgraded to a suite! We still have no idea why, but we definitely weren't complaining. Although the suite was bigger, it was not updated any more than the other rooms. The bathroom was tiny and the bathroom door actually hit the toilet when you opened it which was kind of annoying. Although the entrance and lobby seemed to be updated, the rooms weren't so much. They were perfectly fine with the amount we paid, but would have probably be disappointed had we paid much more. Overall, if you can stay there for around $100-120 a night, I would say it's definitely worth it. Although I can speak to many of the amenities because we did not spend much time at the hotel - more outside of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from Holidy Inn....”
Reviews.Author: evjolin
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel I found myself in line behind a woman checking in because she and her husband were in a fight and she didn't want to stay at home. The poor girl was crying and upset and the WONDERFUL man behind the front desk was so sweet and gracious. So front desk gets 5 stars. This was not the Holiday Inn I stayed at growing up, definitely has gotten better. The room was nice (huge!) but the bath was insanely small. Husband and I could not even be in there brushing our teeth at the same time. Bed was comfy but bring your own pillow....they were lumpy and pretty bad. Overall, would definitely stay there again. As they say location, location, location! All near the hotel: au bon pain, whole foods, pizza place, gas station, cvs, my FAVORITE burrito place ever--anna's taqueria (i used to live in boston and would go to anna's at least 3x a week) and walking distance to beautiful charles street.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNe
Reviews.Content: Had everything to make a comfortable stay and also great central location. Cannot think of any problems. Breakfast was fine. Some reviews mention smallish bathrooms which is true but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: irgo05
Reviews.Content: Hotel exceeded my expectations. We arrived to a super friendly, helpful staff. Our room was spacious and clean, bed very comfy. The bathrooms were tiny, but the towels were abundant soft and clean and products nice. Our room had a flat screen TV, good size refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. The pool was adequate but they did have a lifeguard on duty which I found rather impressive. Off the second floor you can pop out to the shopping area with a Whole Foods and CVS. Convenient! Location was great, not that we were in the heart of it all, but could easily walk to places or hop on the T to get we were going. I thought that since this hotel was so modestly priced (compared to the others...) that I would wish I had ponyed up... not the case! I didnt give it excellent because the walls were a liitle thin, ie could hear neighbors baby crying and we did have a water stain on the ceiling. Didnt bother me but may bother others. I just want to mention again the front desk- very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OhioChowhound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Boston Marathon. The staff was very helpful and even let us check in at 7:30 am when we arrived! Our room was a little older than the ones pictured on the website, but I think that was because they gave us what they had available at that time. It was very clean with nice bed linens and a comfy chair. Some of the furniture was a little old. The bathroom was very small but clean and nice with great water pressure in the shower. The closeness to the Green line T stop was great, and it was easy to walk to the North End and Quincy Market area. I loved having a Whole Foods adjacent to the hotel. The price was great and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: Great location, OK service, room was on the Executive floor and quite good. Really can't complain about price as Boston is pretty pricey. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveler3120
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's just a few blocks from the T stop, and in the beautiful Beacon Hill neighborhood. In addition, it is next door to a Whole Foods and CVS Pharmacy (great if you're traveling with children!). From this location, you can get about anywhere in the city within 10-15 minutes on the T. It is also walking distance to the Common and Quicy Market. The bathrooms are very small, but didn't bother us since we don't have a large family (who spends a lot of time in the bathroom anyway??). The room is what you'd expect from a recently renovated Holiday Inn - nothing spectacular, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJane33
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill in Boston in April of 2008. I got a great rate thru Travelocity. I went for a business trip and arrived at the Hotel at 9 AM expecting to stash my suitcase, but the reception checked me in and gave me a room right away. The porter was very polite and made suggestions for things to do and see when the business part of my trip was over. The hotel is within walking distance of Quincy Market and the Train station at Government Center, which can take you to the airport. There is Whole Foods Market behind the hotel and Mass General Hospital next door. Great neighborhood. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttTheD0t
Reviews.Content: All Boston hotels seem to be overpriced and the Holiday Inn is no exception. The room was clean but small , so small that the toilet door did not open fully as it banged into the toilet bowl. The furniture in the room was old and mismatching and some of it was damaged. Our front door looked like it had been kicked in at some point and fixed with some screws. The carpet in the lifts was filthy and did not give a good first impression. The staff seemed disinterested and the bar food was mediocre at best. The location is ideal though for wandering round the older parts of Boston. It is also right next to the hospital, meaning you will hear lots of ambulances throughout the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katya_NY
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 2 nights via Priceline and were very happily surprised. The location is key in Boston, and hotels are SUPER expensive mid week in the downtown area. We were happily surprised by this Holiday Inn! Great location to walk around town from. Suggestions: Parking is an issue in Boston- $32/day next door self parking- if you valet from the hotel, it is $36/day, and they pull your car into a narrow column behind actual parking spots. Definitely self park if you can! Whole Foods next door, as well as CVS and Au Bon Pain- and a bunch of nice little local places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone03
Reviews.Content: Booked the Holiday Inn through Hotwire for $75 a night - when we rang in advance and asked for a twin room they said they could not promise anything because we booked through a third party. When we arrived we did get a twin room - double beds - rooms are small, bathroom very small, but clean and great showers. Location is very good, 10 minute walk from Quincy Market and Boston Common and a few minutes away from the nearest red line stop which takes you to Harvard in 10 minutes. Staff are very friendly and helpful. There is also a great bar called Sevens just round the corner. All in all, you get more than what you pay for - it's not fancy but it's absolutely fine and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I don't mean to damn with faint praise -- we booked the Holiday Inn Beacon Hill for a very reasonable rate through Hotwire, and we were not at all disappointed. The location of the hotel is great -- convenient to Charles Street, Beacon Hill, and not far from the Common, Quincy Market, and downtown. We got lucky and found a legal street parking space at 6pm, so we were good for the night. Inside, the hotel is perfectly satisfactory. The facade is new, but a quick study and you get the program: recent facelift on 1970s property. This held true throughout our stay. The lobby is pleasant but small, with low ceilings. The elevators are older but have been face-lifted (they're still very slow, though). The hallways are fine -- dressed up but still narrow and low. And the room, which was comfortably appointed enough, feels like an older, smaller room with nicer finishes. The bathroom was, however, eensy -- which made the whole thing feel small for a family of four when it came time to get ready in the morning. A couple minor glitches in our particular room: The TV cable was out altogether, the wireless connection seemed to bounce randomly, and the beds (which were on the harder side of firm) weren't attached to the headboard, so if two people sat on the foot of the bed at once (we did, several times), the whole bed tips up alarmingly. Overall - a decent hotel for a good price -- conveniently located, satisfactory quality. You could do a lot worse in Boston. I am not sure you can do a lot better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel before and needing something quick I decided to stay again, now read on for my horrible experience. I am a kidney donor for someone in Boston, I live in PIttsburgh. I had to be in Boston for final tissue typing and some other tests. Due to a flight cancellation I had to ride Greyhound to Boston. When I purchased my ticket the Greyhound ticket agent kept my drivers license and credit card. I did not realize this until I was on my way to Boston. I arrived in Boston at 450am. I had my blood tests completed and was tired and needed a room before my afternoon tests. I called Holiday Inn and advised them of my missing ID and that I was a Priority Club Gold member and needed a day room at the Beacon Hill property. They advised that should not be a problem but to call the hotel to book the room. I called the hotel and was told to come over because they do not book day rates over the phone. I took a cab to the hotel and Anna the front desk clerk asked, Do you have a reservation? I advised her I was told to come directly to the hotel. She then booked my room and was aware I was a gold member of Priority Club. She then asked for a credit card. I advised her of my problem with Greyhound. She took cash for the room, gave me my room keys and as I was walking away she said, Oh, I need your ID. I advised her that I did not have the drivers license, but did have an employment photo ID along with my voters registration card. She then said I could not check in without a Massachusetts drivers license. I advised her I do not live in Massachusetts. She then said I could not check in and refunded my money. I was outraged. I am submitting this report because I did pay my money, was given a key and then refused to be allowed to check into my room. I have stayed at this same hotel twice before within the past month. Please take my advice and do not book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: pureyankee
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at this location using points. Rooms were clean, laundry room however was filthy. Service at breakfast was friendly and the food was good. Overall not a very memorable experience. Better values are available in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, clean room”
Reviews.Author: ReallyEnjoyTraveling
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a terrific location. The front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The internet access and fitness room are excellent. The restaurant is decent/good enough. There is a taxi stand right outside, and the T is about 5 blocks away. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Beacon HIll is a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shell-TA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past Veteran's Day weekend for three days and overall we were very pleased. The location just cannot be beat. We only took the T once because we were going somewhere out by Fenway. We attended a concert at TD Banknorth, which was about a 10-minute walk and very convenient. Fanueil Hall was a 15-minute walk. The staff at the hotel was very nice and accommodating. They did have a complimentary breakfast for limited items such as cereal, rolls & yogurt and if you want hot food, it was about $5/person. The only drawbacks I noticed were that the bathroom door hit the toilet if you tried to open it all the way which was a minor thing, but it was annoying. The only other thing that bothered me was that the doors to the rooms shut automatically and they slam when they shut so that unless you hold onto the door to close it, it just slams shut, which was very loud in the middle of the night and woke me up a couple times the first night we were there. The other people in my party were not bothered much by it, but I tend to be a light sleeper. The other nights seemed to be less crowded and the noise at night was not bad at all. Those things would not be enough to make me not want to stay there, though, as the rate we had and the location could not be beat. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but find parking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: pnaw10
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I decided to make a spur-of-the-moment weekend trip to Boston. This was the hotel we happened to get through a website that allows you to name your own price. The hotel itself was great. The facilities are newly renovated, and everything was clean. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. Even though it wasn't right in the heart of downtown, the T Red Line (subway) was just a short walk away. There's free wireless internet in every room, and a "business center" allows you to surf the web and print things out for free. This was a Godsend, since we didn't really do a lot of pre-planning for the trip... we were able to plot out places we wanted to see, and print the necessary Google Maps (and look up stuff like hours, admission fees, and so forth). I had only two minor complaints and one major complaint. Minor complaint #1 - for being such a ritzy-looking hotel, I was surprised to learn the pool is outdoors, and therefore, seasonal. Seems like a hotel that would have an indoor pool. Minor complaint #2 - the windows aren't very energy-efficient. We had to crank up the heat to 75 degrees in order to make up for the coldness near the windows. Only major complaint about this place is that they don't own their own parking facilities. Valets are available to take your car to a nearby private lot, which is a jaw-dropping $36 a day. As nice as this hotel is, it's still not the Ritz Carlton. Who ever expects to pay for parking at a Holiday Inn? I've never been to a hotel where you pay for parking, even at "better" chains like the Radisson or even at Disney World. Thanks to TripAdvisor, I was warned this parking fee by checking the hotel's "amenity" listing, but there weren't really any reviews to point it out, so I wanted to draw attention to it. If you're flying into town and NOT planning to leave Boston at all (ie. don't "need" to rent a car), I suggest taking the T from the airport to the hotel. It's very easy to get around the city if you have an unlimited pass to ride the T, or if you don't mind walking. Take the airport shuttle to South Station... then get the red line to "Charles/MGH." (Yes, if you're looking at Google... the blue line "Bowdoin" station is just as close as the red line, but the blue line doesn't stop there on weekends.) Even if you're driving in like we did, find an outlying T station and ride the train in. Usually the stops at the end of the line have the largest parking facilities. In this case, we parked at Alewife, the station at the western end of the Red Line. It was just a short 6-stop ride to "Charles/MGH," the stop closest to this hotel... and the parking was just $5 a day. So instead of paying $72 for 2 days of parking, we paid just $10. Not to mention, you get to avoid driving in the heavy, hectic city traffic! When you buy a T pass, I suggest the 7-day pass... even if you're only there for a weekend, it's cheaper than buying two 1-day passes. Unlimited rides on any subway or bus, which makes it easy to jump around town without constantly wondering if you've got the right change for fare. The T is pretty clean (though some of the stations are in the midst of much-needed renovatons). We had no problems with it, even at night. Of course, if you've got a big family and lots of luggage... taking the T might not be so convenient. Even for a family of 4, taking the car in and out everywhere might be cheaper than getting 7-day T passes for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to talk about”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: Tired looking although its been renovated. Despite the appearance the bed was comfortable, linens and towels were fine and not much outside noise. I guess the big deal is the flat panel TV. Unfriendly staff in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn at Beacon Hill”
Reviews.Author: SteveBoston
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Nice room. Pleasant staff. They changed to name from Government Center to Beacon Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuySeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business August '07. The location is excellent, as you can easily walk to just about all of Boston's major attractions in 20 minutes or less. We found the front desk staff to be very cheerful and efficient when we checked in at 18:00 - they made a point to upgrade me to the "Executive" (12th) floor due to my Gold status with Priority Club. Not sure what makes this floor different from any other, as the only thing I could see was a room near the elevator that had been turned into a "lounge", but really didn't have much in it. Never saw anyone there. The room was clean, but not really too big. As noted in other reviews of this hotel, the bathroom door did indeed scrape against the toilet, as he bathroom isn't too big. I've seen many older hotels with this same problem. I found the bed to be very comfortable. There is niose from the ambulances headed into the hospital around the corner, and from the Fire Station right across the street. Didn't gget a chance to try the complimentary breakfast buffet that came with my upgrade, as it didn't open until 6:30am, and we needed to be up and out the door headed to The Job by 6:00. Starbucks conveniently located right across the street, and they opened at 6:00. Also a CVS pharmacy and Whole Foods market directly behind the hotel - very convenient. 10-15 minute walk to the North End for great Italian food and of course Mike's Pastry! Parking was $4 per night cheaper if you parked yourself - which was in the same garage as the Valet used, as far as I can tell. Overall, no real complaints. The location is great, staff wee efficient, courteous and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Britgirls
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two night stay here after a bad experience at a hotel in a more out of town location. The hotel is really well located - it's very central and you can walk pretty much everywhere. The hotel is good value for money, the rooms are quite big, and there is an outdoor pool, which is great for the Summer. We loved the Beacon Hill area, especially Charles Street which has lots of little shops and some really nice restaurants. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for those used to luxury”
Reviews.Author: momof3atl
Reviews.Content: ok hotel. In great very safe area. I am a 20 something female and went walking at 10pmon a Thursday. I felt totally safe and there were plenty of people walking around. Not far from Faneuil Hall Market Place also known as Quincy Marketplace. We walked there also and it was a wonderful tourist friendly area with great shops and lots of restaurants. I should have checked this hotel on TripAvdisor first. They are currently adding 6MM worth of upgrades. I hope they start with the bathrooms. The door scrapes against the toilet because it is sooo small. I did not like that at all. The view was horrible. The room was average sized and clean. I paid $300 per night. Had I known better I would have stayed outside of the city,like in Chelsea and got a better hotel. I was there on business and was a little embarrassed to my roommate because we usually stay in nicer places. I did order room service both for dinner and breakfast and was pleasantly surprised. Had a delicious breakfast and the steak was great. The clam chowder was disappointing-I mean it is Boston, right? If I go to Boston I would stay somewhere nicer. However if I wanted a 3 star option, I wouldn't complain about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , Comfortable & Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: mrshert
