Reviews.Content: REALLY NICE...refurbished room, comfortable bed, granite bathroom, no complaints!! Really convenient to Beacon Hill, Government Center, Boston Common.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTim
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Select was fine, although nothing special. We reserved a standard room and were upgraded to a room on the executive (12th) floor, because of my Priority Club membership. That got us what I would describe as a decent room, but again nothing particularly noteworthy. The view was nice, and everything in the room was clean and reasonably modern. There was no in-room safe, which was the only real flaw. There is an executive lounge on the 12th floor, although it really didn't seem to offer any benefit except a small microwave. Our room rate included a complimentary continental breakfast in the ground floor restaurant. We poked our nose in there on the first morning but the buffet looked fairly unappetizing so we went elsewhere. There was a notice posted in the elevator saying that the hotel is undergoing a five-month, very thorough, renovation. We saw no evidence of that, so it may be just beginning, or it may be on floors that we did not see, which is entirely possible. It does suggest, though, that if you're reserving a room, it would be wise to check and see to what extent that construction might affect your stay (i.e. noise, dust, etc.). All in all, a decent place, and no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...at Hotwire rate!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAways
Reviews.Content: My best friend treated me for my birthday to an overnight in Boston!! I checked out the site and was stunned at the rates!! I was sooo glad she mentioned the sweet rate thru Hotwire she got. She booked it on a Tues. and we stayed the Saturday of the same week (last minute sweet deals do happen for Boston). We valet parked overnight for $36, typical fee for Boston hotel. The room had two doubles, and was comfortable for us. The funny thing was that the bathroom door kept getting stuck on the toliet. The sink/counter was nice and made of granite stone. The hotel was only a 15min walk to Faneuil Hall, perfect! (We felt comfortable walking in this area.) The hotel staff were very sweet and so accommodating. We even got a courteous call to make sure the room was okay. As we went out for the evening of fun, we needed a cab. The valet was so sweet, he left his station and ran down to the corner to get a cab for us. Also, I forgot a blouse in the closet, I called hotel and was promptly connected to Lost and Found. Housekeeping returned my call within the hour, they will mail it to me via UPS. I would definitely stay here again.....at Hotwire rate! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “What renovations?”
Reviews.Author: Kcz
Reviews.Content: Boston is getting prohibitively expensive for a quick weekend getaway, so we were pleased to find a centrally located hotel for under $200 a night. Easy to get around to everything, hotel on premises convenient, staff was great. I thought the room was a little shabby, but knew they are undergoing rennovations so figured they just hadn't reached the 10th floor yet. Then my husband pointed out the display in the lobby of the new curtains, carpets, wallpaper, etc. and realized our room had already been redecorated! However, there were (small) holes in the wall, all of the wooden furniture was worn and scratched, and the security lock on the door was pulled away from the wood with the screws hanging out. For location and price, can't be beat - just don't expect too much from their rennovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, helpful, Top place to stay”
Reviews.Author: carinabramley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2005 to see in the new year, and found this hotel great. We arrived very quickly from the airport and found taxis quite cheap (there were 4 of us sharing). We were checked in fast and within 10mins of arriving at the hotel we were in our room and unpacking. The beds are comfortable, the space is big, and the bathrooms clean. We found no problems, except maybe the ice machine was dry on more than one occasion! It is close to all the local attractions, and by foot, so that ou dont have to pay out. The shops and chemist attached to the complex came in very handy, and i always fund them to be safe. Im not really toosure what else to write, just if you are expecting it to be the hilton, your wrong, but it certainly isnt one of the bad hotels, the staff are friendly and help out at no extra cost! I would definately reccommend this place to every sort of traveller. And the bagel place a few doors down is amazing! Feel free to contact me if you have any questions, i apologise i do not have photos, didnt have a digital camera back then!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre & under renovation”
Reviews.Author: TeaEarleGreyHot
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, first in June '06, and again in Jan '07. While this review is specifically for the Jan '07 stay, both stays were comparable, Fri+Sat nights, and both were at a nightly rate of $55 via an opaque, prepaid, online booking service (I named my own price). The hotel's own website states: " Please note the hotel will be undergoing renovations from Nov. 1, 2006 until Mar. 30, 2007." My advice is: Do not pay rack rate here until after renovations are complete! On the upside, the room was well-furnished, with two double beds, attractive wall coverings, TV, ironing board and steam iron, free wireless & wired internet (more important than TV!), a small desk, and adequate lighting. There were nice soaps and shampoo/conditioner/lotion in the bathroom, along with clean towels, washcloths, and a coffee maker. As noted by others, the elevators were functional and fast. Climate control in the room was adequate. I also appreciated ceramic coffee mugs and glass tumblers (rather than plastic). And there was a sliding-door closet, with hangars and plenty of storage for luggage, etc. I was annoyed that there was not a luggage rack, however. On the downside... the bathroom ceiling was absolutely filthy with mould and peeling plaster, the grout was mouldy, and the floors stained. I'll stop there, because as noted by the many flyers, the hotel is undergoing renovations to replace all guest bathrooms "from the studs out". The worn carpeting and shabby draperies are also set to be replaced. I can only hope that the hard and uncomfortable mattresses will be replaced too. As noted by others, the rooms facing the hospital do experience sirens and road noise all night long, and I don't think the renovations will fix that. And renovating the tiny bathrooms won't make them any larger. I had little interaction with the desk clerk; however, I was pleased that my advance phone call at 10 PM the day of check in was sufficient for them to hold my room until my very late arrival of 12:30 AM. (Prepaid bookings are sometimes cancelled with no refund if you don't check in before midnight of the arrival date. Fortunately that did not happen to me.) Aside from the items noted above which will be rectified by renovations, my stay was satsifactory, and the price was terrific. The outdoor pool was closed. Others seemed to be enjoying the restaurant, though I ate elsewhere. There isn't a lot of late-night dining in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, other than a pizzeria. There seemed to be a security guard out-and-about, so I always felt safe. Yes, there is a Red Line "T" subway station about two blocks away; the hotel has no self-parking and the adjacent garage charges $36/day with no in/out. (So if you're going to park, use the hotel's valet parking, which is the same price but allows in/out). There is no on-street parking available. I would stay at this hotel again, though I'd really want to find a cheaper parking option. I'm sure that after the renovations, this will be a much more attractive property.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: OK....First off, it is noisy on the rooms that face the street (Fire Station across the street and hospital around the corner)...so, there are sirens. BUT, for the price, you can live with the noise. I stayed during the July 4th weekend in 2006, and, the location was PERFECT! I walked everywhere, or took the "T" (two stations nearby). Staff extremely friendly and accomodating. Rooms, for the price and for Boston, were very spacious and well taken care of. Numerous elevators, so never really had to wait. Breakfast was sufficent.

Reviews.Title: “Room is quite nice for a Holiday Inn but could easily hear people next door”
Reviews.Author: gottagosomewhere
Reviews.Content: Room: Room was nice for a Holiday Inn but I could hear the people next door easily as if they were in the same room as I. The good thing was that they weren't party types. Luckily, on my 2nd and 3rd night there was no one next door which meant I was able to have no voices going through the wall. A few doors down some rowdy college kids were having their room parties and I would imagine that the people next door would have been quite annoyed. Food: The food from the restaurant was bland and avoided it later by going to Au Bon Pain (sandwiches I thought were decent and a cheaper alternative) which is located very nearby. Price: I paid about $150 a night including tax but later saw that the Hilton had a deal which wasn't much more expensive than what I had paid. Next time if I were going to split the cost of the room I would definitely not hesitate to stay at the Hilton or another similar hotel if there was a deal to be had. Good things about this Holiday Inn: Staff are very nice, location is good and the room/furniture were nice for a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “medium”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: we just walked in for 2 nights stay. the stuff was friendly, efficient and cooperative. nice place, quite basic though. we paid $270 per night, including taxes and valet parking. for this price we expected a little bit more. i would come again but for lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: pmonachina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August. Within walking distance to everywhere especially the North End. Quality restaurants are nearby also. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable. Great place to stay if your have someone at Mass General Hospital- it is a block away. I will stay there again on my next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with problems”
Reviews.Author: sentry4500
Reviews.Content: Good location. Whole foods and Au bon pain right around the corner. Rooms were OK, though bathroom was patched up with wood panels (looked real ugly), and a mirror attached to the shower was broken and limp. I'd say a good deal if you pay around $100. If you pay the $200 posted on their website, I'd say you're better off at the Omni or some other chains. The service really needs to be worked on. After check in, got a call from the front desk if I needed anything (nice touch). I said yes, toothpaste and a wine opener. They said they'll bring it right up. over an hour later, nothing. Called again, nothing. Called again, said it was 3rd time calling, and that if the wine opener isn't available, just let me know and I'll go out and buy one or something. Again an hour passes nothing. Finally called for the 4th time and the housekeeping comes with the toothpaste, has no idea about the wine opener, finally am told later that wine openers are not available and had to go down to the bar to get it opened. Wine openers aren't available, and I understand that, but all in all it took over 4 hours and 4 phone calls to get a tube of toothpaste up to my room. DEFINITELY could use better management and a lesson in service.

Reviews.Title: “Best price in Boston for a 3-star”
Reviews.Author: Kinnereth
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Friday in June with a hotel full of other Red Sox fans; fun! Note, however, that the hotel is NOT within walking distance to Fenway Park unless you're up for a two-mile walk; cabs are plentiful, or the subway is very convenient to both the hotel and the ballpark. There are other hotels much more convenient to Fenway, but the price is insane, $300 a night and up. Book on the Holiday Inn website for good prices, detailed description of the options, and Priority Club points. When I checked in, I got a surprise upgrade to the executive floor as a Priority Club member! Very nice room. Spacious and very clean. This hotel was safe, clean, and quiet; as noted, most guests this date were families in town for a Red Sox game. (Looks like it's mostly a business hotel during the week; Mass Gen Hospital is right next door.) Jimmy at the front desk is great. The hotel is in a city neighborhood, but not a bad neighborhood. Plenty of amenities within a block; Starbucks of course, CVS (drugstore), Whole Foods Market, White Hen Pantry (like a 7-11) I went to Pizzetta Pizzeria right across the street that had great pizza and calzones for a post-game snack. It was full of locals, always a good sign. The sign said it was open until 3 a.m. on weekends! Hotel does have an outdoor pool, which I didn't check out but looked good through the window. Great location convenient to most of what Boston has to offer, clean and well-run, and cheaper than the comparable chains. Only warning: stay away from the hotel restaurant. Breakfast from the buffet was so cold that it was inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great for Family”
Reviews.Author: Megala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 2006. I looked and looked through tripadvisor to try and find a hotel for my family which includes 2 kids 6 and 8 years old. This hotel was by far lower in price than the other Boston hotels and is in a great location. It is in a safe location, close to the subway (which is wonderful) and about a 10 min. walk to the marketplace and Fanieull Hall. The hotel itself is older so the rooms were not real updated and the bathroom did have some mold on the ceiling however the beds and everything else was clean and well taken care of. The pool is outside and a decent size with lifeguard. It has a 1 foot side then goes 5 to 9 foot. If you ask for a higher floor you can see some of the Charles River. We really didn't stay in hotel that long except for night because we were on the move constantly. The hotel restaurant was pricey but a dunkin doughnuts is nearby. I do recommend doing a duck tour first if it's your first time. This way you can figure out what all you want to take a closer look at.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: Boston is an expensive city that I love to visit! The Holiday Inn Government Center is a perfectly adequate hotel, but nothing overly special. However, both the price and location are ideal. I pre-paid $200 a night (that includes all the taxes) for this hotel that is located only 10 minutes from a major T-stop that includes both the Green and Blue Lines. Faneuil Hall and the waterfront are an additional five minutes from the T-stop. The Charles River and the Museum of Science are within easy walking distance. The hotel is located on a side street right around the corner from Cambridge Avenue which is a MAJOR street in the area, so there was some noise in the morning from traffice. However, Cambridge offers every service you would need, so it was worth a little disturbance. I included two photos that were taken out of our hotel room. We had views of both downtown Boston and the Charles River. Really not a bad choice at all. I had considered staying outside of Boston and taking the T in, but both my son and I agreed that we just love staying in the city and this hotel made that possible without breaking my budget. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BMichal
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a stay. We stayed in the executive section and had a nice, small room with a king sized bed. Good for a couple and a small daughter. The staff was excellent. We were greated by everyone and although we arrived early and our room was not ready, we were allowed to leave our baggage so that we could go around the city. The food was fine. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. My picky daughter ate 2 full plates of food. The hotel was in walking distance to everything; Quincy Market and the TD Banknorth Center. Walking distance that a five year old could certainly handle. We booked directly through Holiday Inn, and couldn't have been easier.

Reviews.Title: “could do wit refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Jake36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July. The location is superb within walking disance of downtown Boston.. the front desk staff were very nice and obliging as were the bell boys and other staff. (Except the male bartender who seemed to be in charge of the bar.) No conversation out of him at all, and he always looked as if he wanted to be somewhere else, and the amazing thing was he wore a green bade saying he was here to help) in fact the bar itself wasnt great, very dead and no more than three people ever in it,, and they close at 11 pm sharp. The rooms were not to bad considering that the hotel corridors were very dark and dreary. this place definetely needs a lick of paint and new carpets and furniture. There is great bar across the road on Cambridge street , (think its called he Hill) which is lively and they also serve good food which is reasonably priced. Overall I was disappointed in the standard of decor in the Holiday Inn, and while it was reasonaly clean, it doesnt come up to the same standards as other hotels I have stayed in in this chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: sacharama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend in Boston. Our stay at the Holiday Inn Govt Center was a pleasant surprise. It's located close to Charles St (lots of antique shops) and 2 or 3 blocks from the Govt Center T stop. Also right next door to a Whole Foods, which really came in handy. The room itself was small but more than adequate, with a fridge, a view of the Charles River, and most importantly, a bed with cotton linens and good pillows. Another review mentioned sirens but even tho the hotel is near Mass General, we never heard an ambulance, just the very occasional police siren. The room was quiet. I rarely sleep well in hotels but slept great here. The staff was helpful and friendly. Due to the high cost of parking ($36 per day- our only complaint) we parked outside the city and took the T in. We booked this on Priceline for $125 a night- a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself I thought was average, but the staff were outstanding, the location was very good and the room was quiet. Each night the rooms around us were full and I rarely heard my neighbors. Beds were a bit hard though. One morning we came down for breakfast in the restaurant and the hostess was busy but another hotel employee saw us waiting to be seated and promptly showed us a table and brought us menus even though it clearly wasn't his job to do so. That is the type of service we received from all of the staff and it is what made out stay above average. We took the "T" between the Airport and the Hotel. On the way in we took the Silver Line to the South Station, transferring to the Red Line to the Charles/MGH Station and on the way back to the airport we took the Blue Line from Government Centre to the Airport Station and caught the Airport Shuttle. Either way is quick and efficient and at $1.25 you can't go wrong. This hotel has a nice patio on the 2nd floor with an outdoor pool and a guest laundry room with a couple of coin-operated washers and dryers.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and great Location”
Reviews.Author: wallcova
Reviews.Content: A reall nice hotel - lovely rooms and great service. Couldn't be faulted.Really quiet but just a 5 minute walk from the centre of town. oN cambridge Street there is a basic cafe bbut serves great breakfasts - avoid the Italian next to it on the corner though - overpriced and overcooked. Hotel is also handy as there is a little shopping centre just behind. Enjoy your stay we did PS: THESE NO NEED TO USE THE SUBWAY - EVERYWHERE IS WITHIN A 10 MINUTE WALK

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Select! Traveling with friends on pleasure in early April. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, rooms were clean, updated and well kept. The hallways and hotel lobby area, and bar were also clean, updated and well kept. Location was good, easy to get around and taxi's from the hotel to other tourist hotspots were reasonable. Highly recommend this quiet, clean hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nursespark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Select on Blossom Street for four nights this past very rainy weekend. The hotel is located in a safe area near Massachusetts General Hospital. Some of the guests seem to be patients and their families. The hotel and room were nice, very clean, and the staff was pleasant. This hotel is within a 15-minute walk of the Museum of Science in one direction and a 15-minute to government center and the North End (with all of the great Italian Restaurants). There is a small lobby and a restaurant onsite. I did not eat at the restaurant since Boston has so many fabulous restaurants. My only complaint was at $36 per day, parking was expensive. The hotel is close to the T (the subway trains). We went all over the city using the subway, which is easy to use. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. This was a celebration weekend for my daughter who was graduating from Boston University. Over the weekend, we ate at three great restaurants. These three great restaurants were Carmenâ€™s (Italian.) on North Street in the North End (a small place that was very romantic with excellent food), Bobâ€™s Southern Bistro on Columbus Ave in the South End (Soul food with great friendly service with good ribs, excellent jambalaya, excellent corn muffins and other southern food). Bobâ€™s Southern Bistro has live Jazz that was good but a bit noisy since we were two tables up from the stage. (Next time, I will ask for a table closer to the door). It was a good place for a big group and the prices here are very reasonable. There was a $ 5 per person cover charge added for the Jazz. Our big, special dinner was at the Elephant Wok on Beacon Street in Alston. This restaurant was amazing, there were several big groups of 10-14 people (all of the graduates and their families) that the restaurant was serving and they managed to give excellent service. The food is upscale Cambodian and French. The food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buckie112
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my visit to this hotel in july 2004. It was my first visit to the US and if I ever go back to Boston, it is likely that it will be this hotel. Breakfast was of good quality, rooms were spacious and very clean. I found that the reception desk was very friendly and helpfull. There was one guy at the reception that never seemed to stop smiling, and was always especially helpfull in my opinion. The hotel has a very nice location, by which I mean u can easily get everywhere starting from this hotel. There is a metro stop very nearby. However, it is located on a busy road and there is a fire station right across the street and Massachusets General Hospital is just one block away. So you will have some traffic noise and sirens of ambulances and the FD. I have no problem with that, but if you're a difficult sleeper you might want to consider a room that's not on the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Shady, but overall Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal on Hotwire, a room on a Saturday night for $69 at the Holiday Inn Select. Since we got such a great deal I can't really complain but I can say the parking is expensive $36 overnight and the valet is NOT friendly. When we checked in there was a huge group of high school kids waiting for the elevator hooting and hollering and I was praying we were not next to them! Luckily we weren't. Our room was pretty average sized, seemed clean, although the hotel itself is kind of grubby. If you get a great deal go for it, otherwise I am sure there are nicer places. It is not in a touristy area, and you need to take a cab to get to any good restaurants or bars. Our room overlooked an old parking lot and the vending machines were almost empty when I went looking for a snack. We stood outside in the rain waiting for a cab while the valet ignored us until I went over and asked if cabs were in the area, he did help flag one down....

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: maxmuscle03843
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Massachusetts General Hospital, and is a few blocks away from a subway stop. The staff were very friendly and accomodating at check in and check out. The elevators were fairly quick in getting you to your floor. The rooms themselves were adaquate. However, we could here people taking and the television in the room next door, so the sound proofing was not totally perfect. The furnishing were a little bit worn, but not totally broken down. The king bed room was decent size, but the bathroom was really small. There was a good size closet for hanging clothes, a writing desk and a chair with duvet. Overall, not a bad place to rest your head, but certainly not a first class hotel. It proably deserves it's current star rating.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: ghostwriter_min
Reviews.Content: Had 3 great nights at the HI Select in Boston. Staff at check-in was quite friendly. Booked through easyclicktravel and got the requested 2-bed-room. Was expecting 2 doubles, but when I mentioned my Priority Club No., we got upgraded to the Priority Club floor with 2 queens in the room. The guy at the check-in even gave us coupons for free continental breakfast every morning - really nice! The rooms had a good size, were cozy and absolutely clean! If you don`t mind a little walking you barely have to use the T. Faneuil Hall, Downtown, North End, TD Banknorth Garden, the Freedom Trail and much more are in walking distance. But there are also 2 T-Stations close by! Overall we had 3 great days in Boston and the HI Select Government Center!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not the best”
Reviews.Author: siouxzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Holiday Inn Select Boston Government Center Sept 3-6, 2005 while on a mini vacation, we paid $98 a night through Priceline which was a good deal for Boston. However, if you're driving to Boston beware: hotel parking is an additional $35 per night & if you're using Priceline you don't find out about this until after your Priceline reservation is complete. After learning this, we modified our travel plans & decided not to drive our own car to Boston, thus saving us $105 in hotel parking fees. The front desk staff could use a refresher course in customer service, when I requested 2 double beds upon check-in (there were 4 of us staying) I was told that only king sized beds were available (this seems to be a common theme when booking through Priceline so if you have more then 2 in your party I would NOT recommend using Priceline). I nicely requested a cot & was told that one would be sent one to our room, after 30 minutes the cot still hadn't arrived so on our way out to dinner I stopped by the front desk to check on the cot. This time I was snidely told by a different front desk rep that a cot could be sent to our room but it will cost an additional $20 per night! Since we needed a cot I said fine & continued on to dinner feeling very disappointed that Holiday Inn would charge an additional $20 a night to provide their guests with a cot, as they are complimentary in most hotels (I was just glad that we decided not to drive our own car because $35 for parking plus $20 for a cot would have added an extra $55 a night to our bill - we could have stayed at a better hotel for that price!). Aside from my poor customer service experience, I found the hotel to meet our needs. The room was a nice size & clean, complimentary high speed internet access is available in the room if you have a laptop. The location is decent but its in the Financial District which caters more towards business people, then tourists so you'll have to walk about a mile or so to get to any attractions /subway stops. I probably wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel due to the location but other then that it was fine. On our last day, when I went to check out, I was surprised to find that there actually was no additional $20 a night charge for the cot, it was complimentary. I guess the front desk rep was just in a foul mood & wanted to try & put a damper other people's fun.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, very good location”
Reviews.Author: anonima
Reviews.Content: The bathroom is very good, the shower is fantastic and there are lots of amenities. However the rooms are old, they are very big and clean, but need some renovation. There were works outside, and it was very noise. The location is great

Reviews.Title: “Only if you can get a great price”
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Holiday Inn select...good location, although a little walk to the subway [about 1/2 mile], but across the street from Beacon Hill, and could walk to Fanuiel Hall in 10 minutes...actually walked from the waterfront to hotel in about 30 minutes. The hotel lobby was small, non descript. Staff helpful, but seemed disinterested. The "Beantown Trolley", the hop off and on tour bus, stopped just outside the hotel, very convienent. The restaurant was way overpriced [tuna sandwich for $10], and but a few places nearby. There was a sandwich place, chinese restaurant, middle east and of course starbucks across the street, and a local grocery store. The area is a little run down, and with TWO liquor stores nearby, some unsavory characters milling about. The room was large for hotel standards, and the housekeeping was excellent, but there was a large painting missing from over the bed, complete with hanging screws. The room was quiet, the bed comfortable, great a/c, bathroom on the small side. The outdoor pool on the second floor was nice, plently of towels and chairs, and opened to 9pm...nice for a dip after a long day of walking boston. We did not spend much time in the room itself, and for the hotwire price of $86 a night [vs the usual price of $175], it was a bargain. Do not think we would pay full price, though. I would only recommend it only if you can get it deeply discounted, as it is only very ordinary, nothing special.
